    <dl>
           <dt>va 1</dt>
           <dd><em>va</em> the 3rd semivowel (corresponding to the vowels <em>u</em> and <em>&#x016b;</em>, and having the sound of the English <em>v</em>, except when forming the last member of a conjunct consonant, in which case it is pronounced like <em>w</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; it is often confounded and interchanged with the labial consonant <em>b</em>)</dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; vak&#x0101;ra </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x25cb;k&#x0101;ra</em> m. the letter or sound <em>va</em> TPr&#x0101;t </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>-bheda</em> m. N. of a treatise on the proper spelling of words beginning with <em>v</em> or <em>b</em></dd>

           <dt>va 2</dt>
           <dd><em>va</em> (only L.) m. air, wind </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the arm </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; N. of Varu&#x1e47;a </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the ocean, water </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; addressing </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; reverence </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; conciliation </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; auspiciousness </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a dwelling </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a tiger </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; cloth </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the esculent &#x221a;of the water-lily </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (<em>&#x0101;</em>), f. going </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; hurting </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; an arrow </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; weaving </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a weaver (?). n. a sort of incantation or Mantra (of which the object is the deity Varu&#x1e47;a) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; = <em>pra-catas</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; mfn. strong, powerful</dd>

           <dt>va 3</dt>
           <dd><em>va</em> ind.= <em>iva</em>, like, as MBh. K&#x0101;v. &amp;c. (in some more or less doubtful cases)</dd>

           <dt>va&#x1e43;&#x015b;a </dt>
           <dd><em>va&#x1e43;&#x015b;&#x00e1;</em> m. (derivation doubtful) the bamboo cane or any cane (accord. to L. also 'sugarcane' and '&#x1e62;orea Robusta') RV. &amp;c. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the upper timbers or beams of a house, the rafters or laths fastened to the beams (of a roof </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; cf. <em>pr&#x0101;c&#x012b;na-v&#x25cb;</em>) AV. &amp;c. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a cross-beam, joist, joint VarB&#x1e5b;S </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a reed-pipe, flute, fife K&#x0101;v. R&#x0101;jat </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the back-bone, spine VarB&#x1e5b;S. BhP </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a hollow or tubular bone BhP. (B.) Sch </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the upper nasal bone L </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the central projecting part of a scimitar or sabre VarB&#x1e5b;S </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the line of a pedigree or genealogy (from its resemblance to the succession of joints in a bamboo), lineage race, family, stock &#x015a;Br. &amp;c. &amp;c. (esp. a noble race, a dynasty of kings, a list of teachers &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#P&#x0101;&#x1e47;">P&#x0101;&#x1e47;.</a> 2-1, 19 Sch.) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; offspring, a son BhP </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (ifc.) a succession or collection of similar things, assemblage multitude, host (as of chariots, stars &amp;c.) MBh. K&#x0101;v. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a partic. measure of length (= 10 Hastas) L&#x012b;l </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a partic. musical note &#x015a;i&#x015b; </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; pride, arrogance V&#x0101;s </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; bamboo-manna L </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; N. of Vish&#x1e47;u L. (<em>&#x0101;</em>) f. N. of an Apsaras (daughter of Pr&#x0101;dh&#x0101;) MBh </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (<em>&#x012b;</em>), f. See s.v</dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; va&#x1e43;&#x015b;a&#x1e5b;&#x1e63;i </dt>

           <dt>vac </dt>
           <dd><em>vac</em> cl. 2. P. (Dh&#x0101;tup. xxiv, 55) <em>vakti</em> (occurs only in sg. <em>vacmi</em>, <em>vak&#x1e63;i</em>, <em>vakti</em>, and Impv. <em>vaktu</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; Ved. also cl. 3. P. <em>v&#x00ed;vakti</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; pf. <em>uv&#x0101;&#x0341;ca</em>, <em>&#x016b;j</em> RV. &amp;c. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>uv&#x00e1;ktha</em> AV </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>vav&#x0101;ca</em>, <em>vavak&#x1e63;&#x00e9;</em> RV </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; aor. <em>avocat</em>, <em>&#x25cb;cata</em> RV. &amp;c. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; in Veda also Subj. <em>vocati</em>, <em>&#x25cb;te</em>, <em>vec&#x0101;ti</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; Pot. <em>voc&#x00e9;t</em>, <em>&#x25cb;ceta</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; Impv. <em>vocatu</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; Prec. <em>ucy&#x0101;sam</em> Br </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; fut. <em>vakt&#x0101;&#x0341;</em> ib. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>vak&#x1e63;y&#x00e1;ti</em> RV. &amp;c. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>&#x25cb;te</em> MBh </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; Cond. <em>avak&#x1e63;yat</em> Br. Up </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; inf. <em>v&#x00e2;ktum</em> Br. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>&#x25cb;tave</em> RV </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>&#x25cb;tos</em> Br </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; ind. p. <em>uktv&#x0101;&#x0341;</em> Br. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>-&#x00fa;cya</em> ib.), to speak, say, tell, utter, announce, declare, mention, proclaim, recite, describe (with acc. with or without <em>prati</em> dat. or gen. of pers., and acc. of thing </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; often with double acc., e.g. <em>tam ida&#x1e43; v&#x0101;kyam uv&#x0101;ca</em>, 'he spoke this speech to him' </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; with double acc. also, to name, call', &#x0100;. with nom </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; 'one's self' </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; with <em>punar</em>, 'to speak again, repeat' </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; or 'to answer, reply') RV. &amp;c. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to reproach, revile (acc.) Hariv. R.: Pass. <em>ucy&#x00e1;te</em> (aor. <em>av&#x0101;ci</em>, or in later language <em>avoci</em>), to be spoken or said or told or uttered &amp;c. RV. &amp;c. &amp;c. (<em>yad ucyate</em>, 'what the saying is') </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to resound RV </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to be called or accounted, be regarded as, pass for (nom. L. also loc.) Mn. MBh. &amp;c.: Caus. <em>v&#x0101;cayati</em>, <em>&#x25cb;te</em> (Pot. <em>v&#x0101;cay&#x012b;ta</em> A&#x015b;vG&#x1e5b; </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; aor. <em>aviivacat</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; Pass. <em>v&#x0101;cyate</em>), to cause to say or speak or recite or pronounce (with, double acc </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; often the object is to be supplied) Br. G&#x1e5b;S. MBh. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to cause anything written or printed to speak, i.e. to read out loud Hariv. K&#x0101;v. Kath&#x0101;s. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (Dh&#x0101;tup. xxxiv, 35) to say, tell, declare Bha&#x1e6d;&#x1e6d; </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to promise MBh.: Desid. <em>vivak&#x1e63;ati</em>, <em>&#x25cb;te</em> (Pass. <em>vivak&#x1e63;yate</em>), to desire to say or speak or recite or proclaim or declare MBh. K&#x0101;v. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (Pass.) to be meant Sa&#x1e43;k. Sarvad.: Intens. (only <em>&#x00e1;v&#x0101;vac&#x012b;t</em>) to call or cry aloud RV. x, 102, 6. [Cf. Gk. ? for ? in ?, ?, ? &amp;c. ; Lat. <em>vocare</em>, <em>vox</em> ; [912, 1] Germ. <em>gi-waht</em>, <em>gi-wahinnen</em>, [er-wÂ"hnen].]</dd>

           <dt>&#x226b; vaktave </dt>
           <dd><em>vaktave</em> Ved. inf. of &#x221a;<em>vac</em> (cf. above) RV. vii, 31, 5 (S&#x0101;y. '<em>v&#x00e1;ktu</em> mfn. speaking harshly, reviling')</dd>

           <dt>&#x226b; vaktavya </dt>
           <dd><em>vaktavy&#x00e1;</em> mf(<em>&#x0101;</em>)n. to be (or being) spoken or said or uttered or declared, fit to be said or spoken &amp;c. &#x015a;Br. &amp;c. &amp;c. (n. impers. 'it should be said' &amp;c.) <font color="#FF0000" font size=-2><a name="p912-2"></a>[Page 912, Column 2]</font> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to be named or called VarB&#x1e5b;S </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to be spoken to or addressed, to be told (with acc. of thing) MBh. K&#x0101;v. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to be spoken about or against, objection. able, reprehensible, vile, low, bad Mn. MBh. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; liable to be called to account, accountable or answerable or responsible or subject to, dependent on (gen. or comp.) MBh. R </dd>

           <dt>vaj </dt>
           <dd><em>vaj</em> (prob. corrupted fr. &#x221a;<em>vraj</em>), cl. 1. P. <em>vajati</em> (pf. <em>vav&#x0101;ja</em> fut. <em>vajit&#x0101;</em> &amp;c., Gr.), to go Dh&#x0101;tup. vii, 78: Caus. or cl. so. P. <em>v&#x0101;jayati</em>, to prepare the way to trim or feather an arrow (<em>m&#x0101;rga-</em>, or <em>m&#x0101;rga&#x1e47;a-sa&#x1e43;sk&#x00e2;re</em>) Dh&#x0101;tup. xxxii, 74. Another &#x221a;<em>vaj</em> or <em>uj</em>, 'to be hard or strong', may be inferred from <em>ugra</em>, <em>ojas</em>, <em>vajra</em>, <em>v&#x0101;ja</em> (qq. vv.), the last of which gave rise to the Nom. <em>v&#x0101;jaya</em>, q.v. [For cognate words See under <em>ugra</em> and <em>ojas</em>.]</dd>

           <dt>&#x226b; vajjadeva </dt>
           <dd><em>vajja-deva</em> m. (prob. for <em>vajra-d&#x25cb;</em>) N. of a king Inscr</dd>

           <dt>&#x226b; vajra </dt>
           <dd><em>v&#x00e1;jra</em> m. n. 'the hard or mighty one', a thunderbolt (esp. that of Indra, said to have been formed out of the bones of the &#x1e5a;ishi Dadh&#x012b;ca or Dadh&#x012b;ci <em>q.v.</em>, and shaped like a circular discus, or in later times regarded as having the form of two transverse bolts crossing each other thus x </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; sometimes also applied to similar weapons used by various gods or superhuman beings, or to any mythical weapon destructive of spells or charms, also to <em>manyu</em>, 'wrath' RV. or [with <em>ap&#x0101;m</em>] to a jet of water AV. &amp;c. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; also applied to a thunderbolt in general or to the lightning evolved from the centrifugal energy of the circular th&#x1e6d;thunderbolt of Indra when launched at a foe </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; in Northern Buddhist countries it is shaped like a dumb-bell and called Dorje </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; See MWB. 201 ; 322 &amp;c.) RV. &amp;c. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a diamond (thought to be as hard as the thunderbolt or of the same substance with it), &#x1e62;advBr. Mn. MBh. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a kind of talc L </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a kind of penance (feeding for a month on only barley prepared with cow's urine) L </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; sour gruel W </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; m. a form of military array, M&#x012b;. MBh. &amp;c. (cf. <em>-vy&#x016b;ha</em>) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a kind of column or pillar VarB&#x1e5b;S </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a partic. form of the moon ib </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a partic. Ek&#x0101;ha, Vtit </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a kind of hard mortar or cement (<em>kalka</em>) VarB&#x1e5b;S. (cf. <em>-lepa</em>) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; N. of the 15th of the 27 Yogas or astronomical divisions of time ib </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a partic. Soma ceremony &#x1e62;a&#x1e0d;vBr </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; Euphorbia Antiquorum and another species L </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; Astera L </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; N. of a mountain R </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; of an Asura Virac </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; of a son of Aniruddha MBh. Hariv. Pur </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; of a son of Vilvamitra MBh </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; of a son of Manu Slvar&#x1e47;a Hariv </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (with Jainas) of one of the 10 Dala-p&#x016b;rvins L </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; of a &#x1e5a;ishi VarB&#x1e5b;S. (v. l. for v&#x0101;tsya) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; of a minister of Narendr&#x0101;ditya R&#x0101;jat </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; of a son of Bh&#x016b;ti ib </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; of a heretical king Buddh </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (<em>&#x0101;</em>), f. Cocculus Cordifolius L </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; Euphorbia Antiquorum or Tirucalli L. N. of Durg&#x0101;, DeviP </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; of a daughter of Vaisvanara VP </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (<em>&#x012b;</em>), f. a kind of Euphorbia L </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; n. denunciation in strong language (compared to thunder) R. S&#x0101;h. Prat&#x0101;p. (cf. <em>v&#x0101;kya-</em> and <em>v&#x0101;g-v&#x25cb;</em>) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a kind of hard iron or steel L </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a partic. posture in sitting Cat. (cf. <em>vajr&#x00e2;sana</em>) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; N. of a partic. configurations of the planets and stars (in which favourable planets are situated in the 1st and 7th houses and unfavourable in the 4th and 10th) VarB&#x1e5b;S </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; myrobolan L </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the blossom of the sesamum or of any plant called Vajra L </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; Andropogon Muricatus L </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; = <em>b&#x0101;laka</em>, a child, pupil L </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; mfn. adamantine, hard, impenetrable W </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; shaped like a kind of cross (cf. above), forked, zigzag ib. [Cf. Zd. <em>va&#x015b;ra</em>, 'a club.'] <font color="#FF0000" font size=-2><a name="p913-2"></a>[Page 913, Column 2]</font>

           <dt>vat 1</dt>
           <dd><em>vat</em> an affix (technically termed <em>vati</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; See P&#x0101;&#x1e47;. 5-1, 115 &amp;c.) added to words to imply likeness or resemblance, and generally translatable by 'as', 'like' (e.g. <em>br&#x0101;hma&#x1e47;a-vat</em>, like a Br&#x0101;hman </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>pit&#x1e5b;-vat</em> = <em>pit&#x00ea;va</em>, <em>pitaram iva</em>, <em>pitur iva</em> and <em>pitar&#x012b;7va</em>)</dd>

           <dt>vatsa </dt>
           <dd><em>vats&#x00e1;</em> m. (prob. originally, 'yearling', fr. a lost word <em>vatas</em>) a calf, the young of any animal, offspring, child (voc. <em>vatsa</em> often used as a term of endearment = my dear child, my darling) RV. &amp;c. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a son, boy ( See <em>b&#x0101;la-v&#x25cb;</em>) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a year ( See <em>tri-v&#x25cb;</em>) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; N. of a descendant of Ka&#x1e47;va RV. Pa&#x00f1;cavBr. &#x015a;&#x0101;&#x1e45;kh&#x015a;r </dd>

           <dd>&#x2022; of a K&#x0101;syapa Kath&#x0101;s </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; of the step-brother of Maitreya (who passed through fire to prove the falseness of Maitreya's allegation that he was the child of a &#x015a;&#x016b;dra) Mn. viii, 116 (Sch.) of a son of Pratardana MBh. Hariv </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; of a son of Sena-jit Hariv </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; of a son of Aksha-m&#x0101;l&#x0101; Cat </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; of a son of Uru-kshepa VP </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; of a son of Soma-&#x015b;arman Kath&#x0101;s </dd>

           <dd>&#x2022; (with <em>carak&#x00e2;dhvaryu-s&#x016b;tra-k&#x1e5b;t</em>) of another author ib </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; of a serpent-demon VP </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; N. of a country (whose chief town is Kau&#x015b;&#x0101;mb&#x012b;) Kath&#x0101;s </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; Nerium Aistidysentericum L </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the Kutaja tree L </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; pl. the descendants of Vatsa &#x0100;&#x015b;v&#x015a;r. (cf. P&#x0101;&#x1e47;. 2-4, 64 Sch.) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the inhabitants of the country called Vatsa MBh. Kath&#x0101;s </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (<em>&#x0101;</em>), f. a female calf, little daughter (voc. <em>vatse</em> = my dear child) K&#x0101;lid. Uttarar. Prab. ; m. n. the breast, chest L.            <dt>vad </dt>
           <dd><em>vad</em> cl. 1. P. &#x0100;. (Dh&#x0101;tup. xxiii, 40) <em>v&#x00e1;dati</em>, <em>&#x25cb;te</em> (ep. m. c. also <em>v&#x0101;dati</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; Pot. <em>udeyam</em> AV </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; pf. <em>uv&#x0101;da</em> pl. <em>&#x016b;dim&#x00e1;</em> RV </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>&#x016b;de</em> &amp;c. Br. Up </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>veditha</em>, <em>&#x25cb;dailu&#x1e25;</em>, <em>&#x25cb;du&#x1e25;</em> Vop </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; aor <em>av&#x0101;d&#x012b;t</em>, <em>&#x25cb;di&#x1e63;u&#x1e25;</em> RV. &amp;c. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; Subj. <em>v&#x0101;di&#x1e63;a&#x1e25;</em> AV </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>av&#x00e2;diran</em> ib </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>vadi&#x1e63;ma</em>, <em>&#x25cb;&#x1e63;ih&#x0101;&#x1e25;</em> Br </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; Prec' <em>udy&#x0101;t</em> ib </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; fut. <em>vadi&#x1e63;y&#x00e1;ti</em>, <em>&#x25cb;te</em> AV. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; inf. <em>v&#x00e1;ditos</em> Br </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>vaditum</em> ib. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; ind. p. <em>uditv&#x0101;</em> G&#x1e5b;&#x015a;rS </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>-udya</em> Br.), to speak, say, utter, tell, report, speak to, talk with, address (P. or &#x0100; </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; with acc. of the thing said, and acc. [with or without <em>abhi</em>] or gen., or loc. of the person addressed <font color="#FF0000" font size=-2><a name="p916-2"></a>[Page 916, Column 2]</font> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; also followed by <em>yad</em>, 'that', or by <em>yadi</em>, 'whether') RV. &amp;c. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (P.) to praise, recommend MBh </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to adjudge, adjudicate TS. BhP </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to indicate, designate VarB&#x1e5b;S </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to proclaim, announce, foretell, bespeak A&#x015b;vG&#x1e5b;. MBh. K&#x0101;v. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to allege, affirm ib </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to declare (any one or anything) to be, call (two acc. or acc. and nom. with <em>iti</em>) AV. &amp;c. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (with or scil. <em>v&#x0101;cam</em>) to raise the voice, sing, utter a cry (said of birds and 9.) RV. &amp;c. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (&#x0100;) to say, tell, speak to (acc.) &#x015a;Br. &amp;c. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to mention, state, communicate, name TS. R. Hariv </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to confer or dispute about RV. TS </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to contend, quarrel &#x015a;Br </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to lay claim to (loc.) AitBr </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to be an authority, be eminent in (loc.) P&#x0101;&#x1e47;. 1-3, 47 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to triumph, exult Bha&#x1e6d;&#x1e6d;.: Pass. <em>udy&#x00e1;te</em> (aor. <em>av&#x0101;di</em>), to be said or spoken &amp;c. AV. &amp;c. &amp;c.: Caus. <em>v&#x0101;d&#x00e1;yati</em> m. c. also <em>&#x25cb;te</em> (cf. P&#x0101;&#x1e47;. 1-3, 89 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; aor. <em>aviivadat</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; Pass. <em>v&#x0101;dyate</em>, ep. also <em>&#x25cb;ti</em>), to cause to speak or say MBh </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to cause to sound, strike, play (with instr., rarely loc. of the instrument) &#x015a;Br. MBh. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to play music MBh. R. Hariv </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (with <em>bahu</em>) to make much ado about one's self. Subh </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to cause a musical instrument (acc.) to be played by (instr.) P&#x0101;&#x1e47;. 1-1, 58 V&#x0101;rtt. 2 Pat </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to speak, recite, rehearse Hariv.: Desid. <em>vivadi&#x1e63;ati</em>, <em>&#x25cb;te</em>, to desire to speak, Br Gobh.: Intens. <em>v&#x0101;&#x0341;vad&#x012b;ti</em> (RV. AV.), <em>v&#x0101;vady&#x00e1;te</em>, (&#x015a;Br.), <em>v&#x0101;vatti</em> (Gr.), to speak or sound aloud. [Cf. Lit. <em>vad&#x00ed;nti</em>.]</dd>

           <dt>van 1</dt>
           <dd><em>van</em> cl. 1. P. (Dh&#x0101;t&#x012b;p. xiii, 19 ; 20 ; xix, 42) <em>v&#x00e1;nati</em> (Ved. also <em>&#x25cb;te</em>, and <em>van&#x00e1;ti</em>) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; cl. 8. P. &#x0100;. (xxx, 8) <em>van&#x00f3;ti</em>, <em>vanut&#x00e9;</em> (pf. <em>v&#x0101;v&#x0101;&#x0341;na</em>, <em>v&#x0101;v&#x00e1;ntha</em>, <em>vavanm&#x00e1;</em>, <em>vavn&#x00e9;</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; p. <em>vavanv&#x00e1;s</em> RV </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; aor. <em>vanta</em>, <em>v&#x00e1;&#x1e43;sva</em> ib </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>va&#x1e43;sat</em>, <em>&#x25cb;sate</em> ib </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>vani&#x1e63;at</em> AV </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>&#x25cb;&#x1e63;anta</em> TS </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>vanu&#x1e63;anta</em>' RV </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; Pot. <em>va&#x1e43;s&#x012b;mahi</em>, <em>vas&#x012b;mahi</em> ib </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; Prec. <em>vani&#x1e63;&#x012b;&#x1e63;ta</em> RV. <em>va&#x1e43;si&#x1e63;&#x012b;ya</em> AV </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; fut. <em>vani&#x015b;&#x0101;</em> Gr </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>vani&#x1e63;yate</em>, S&#x0101;&#x1e45;khSr </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; inf. <em>vanitum</em> Gr </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>-vantave</em> RV.), to like, love, wish, desire RV. AV. &#x015a;Br. K&#x0101;&#x1e6d;h. &#x015a;&#x0101;&#x1e45;khSr </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to gain, acquire, procure (for one's self or others) RV. AV. &#x015a;Br </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to conquer, win, become master of, possess RV. AV </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to prepare, make ready for, aim at, attack RV </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to hurt, injure MW. (Dh&#x0101;tup. also 'to sound' </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; 'to serve, honour, worship. help, aid'): Caus. <em>vanayati</em> or <em>v&#x0101;nayati</em> Dh&#x0101;tup. xix, 68 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; xxxix, 33, v&#x1e37;. (cf. <em>sa&#x1e43;-&#x221a;van</em>): Desid. <em>v&#x00ed;v&#x0101;sati</em>, <em>&#x25cb;te</em>, to attract, seek to win over RV.: Intens. (only <em>v&#x0101;v&#x00e1;na&#x1e25;</em> and <em>v&#x0101;vandh&#x00ed;</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; but cf. <em>van&#x012b;van</em>) to love, like RV. [Cf. Lat. <em>venia</em>, <em>Venus</em> ; Got. <em>gawinnan</em> ; Germ. <em>gewinnen</em> ; Eng. <em>win</em>.]</dd>

           <dd><em>v&#x00e1;ndana</em> m. N. of a &#x1e5a;ishi (who was cast into a well, along with Rebha, by the Asuras, and rescued by the A&#x015b;vins) RV </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (<em>&#x0101;</em>), f. praise, worship, adoration L </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (with Buddhists) one of the 7 kinds of Anuttara-p&#x016b;j&#x0101; or higbest worship (the other 6 being <em>p&#x016b;jan&#x0101;</em>, <em>p&#x0101;pa-de&#x015b;an&#x0101;</em>, <em>anumodan&#x0101;</em>, <em>adhye&#x1e63;a&#x1e47;&#x0101;</em>, <em>badhi-citt&#x00e2;tp&#x00e2;da</em> and <em>pari&#x1e47;aman&#x0101;</em>) Dharmas. 1 4 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a mark or symbol impressed on the body (with ashes &amp;c.) Vas. <font color="#FF0000" font size=-2><a name="p919-2"></a>[Page 919, Column 2]</font> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (<em>&#x012b;</em>), f. (only L.) reverence </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a drug for resuscitating the dead (= <em>j&#x012b;v&#x0101;tu</em>) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; begging or thieving (<em>y&#x0101;cana</em>. or <em>m&#x0101;cala-karman</em>) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the hip or a species of tree (<em>ka&#x1e6d;&#x012b;</em> or <em>va&#x1e6d;&#x012b;</em>) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; = <em>go-rocana</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; n. the act of praising, praise RV </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; reverence (esp. obeisance to a Brahman or superior by touching the feet &amp;c.), worship, adoration Mn. MBh. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a parasitical plant AV. Bhpr </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a disease attacking the limbs or joints, cutaneous emption, scrofula (also personified as a demon) RV </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; = <em>vadana</em> L</dd>

           <dd><em>v&#x00e1;r&#x012b;man</em> n. = 1. <em>variman</em>, expanse, width, breadth, room RV</dd>

           <dt>&#x226b; var&#x012b;yas 1</dt>
           <dd><em>v&#x00e1;r&#x012b;yas</em> mfn. (compar. of <em>ur&#x00fa;</em> q.v.) wider, broader ('than', abl.) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; freer, easier ib. &#x015a;Br </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (<em>as</em>), ind. farther, farther off or away RV </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; n. wider space ('than', abl.) ib </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; free space, freedom, comfort, ease, rest ib</dd>

           <dt>&#x226b; varu&#x1e47;a </dt>
           <dd><em>v&#x00e1;ru&#x1e47;a</em> m. (once in the T&#x0100;r. <em>varu&#x1e47;&#x00e1;</em>) 'Allenveloping Sky', N. of an &#x0100;ditya (in the Veda commonly the night as Mitra over the day, but often celebrated separately, whereas Mitra is rarely invoked alone </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; Varu&#x1e47;a is one of the oldest of the Vedic gods, and is commonly thought to correspond to the ? of the Greeks, although of a more spiritual conception </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; he is often regarded as the supreme deity, being then styled 'king of the gods' or 'king of both gods and men' or 'king of the universe' </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; no other deity has such grand attributes and functions assigned to him </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; he is described as fashioning and upholding heaven and earth, as possessing extraordinary power and wisdom called <em>m&#x0101;y&#x0101;</em>, assending his spies or messengers throughout both worlds, as numbering the very winkings of men's eyes, as hating falsehood, as seizing transgressors with his <em>p&#x0101;&#x015b;a</em> or noose, as inflicting diseases, especially dropsy, as pardoning sin, as the guardian of immortality </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; he is also invoked in the Veda together with Indra, and in later Vedic literature together with Agni, with Yama, and with Vish&#x1e47;u </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; in RV. iv, 1, 2, he is even called the brother of Agni </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; though not generally regarded in the Veda as a god of the ocean, yet he is often connected with the waters, especially the waters of the atmosphere or firmament, and in one place [RV. vii, 64, 2] is called with Mitra, <em>sindhu-pati</em>, 'lord of the sea or of rivers' </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; hence in the later mythology he became a kind of Neptune, and is there best known in his character of god of the ocean </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; in the MBh. Varu&#x1e47;a is said to be a son of Kardama and father of Pushkara, and is also variously represented as one of the Deva-gandharvas, as a N&#x0101;ga, as a king of the Nagas, and as an Asura </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; he is the regent of the western quarter [cf. <em>loka-p&#x0101;la</em>] and of the Nakshatra &#x015a;atabhishaj <em>VarB&#x1e5b;&#x1e63;.</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the Jainas consider Varu&#x1e47;a as a servant of the twentieth Arhat of the present Avasarpi&#x1e47;&#x012b;) RV. &amp;c. &amp;c. (cf IW. 10 ; 12 &amp;c.) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the ocean VarB&#x1e5b;S </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; water Kath&#x0101;s </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the sun L </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; awarder off or dispeller S&#x0101;y. on RV. v, 48, 5 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; N. of a partic. magical formula recited over weapons R. (v. l. <em>vara&#x1e47;a</em>) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the tree Crataeva Roxburgh&#x012b; L. (cf. <em>vara&#x1e47;a</em>) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; pl. (prob.) the gods generally AV. iii, 4, 6 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (<em>&#x0101;</em>), f. N. of a river MBh</dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; varu&#x1e47;ak&#x0101;&#x1e63;&#x1e6d;hik&#x0101; </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x25cb;k&#x0101;&#x1e63;&#x1e6d;hik&#x0101;</em> f. wood of the Ficus Religiosa (used for kindling fire by rubbing) L</dd>

           <dt>&#x226b; vartave </dt>
           <dd><em>v&#x00e1;rtave</em> Ved. inf. fr. &#x221a;1. <em>v&#x1e5b;</em>, q.v</dd>

           <dt>&#x226b; vart&#x1e5b; </dt>

           <dt>&#x226b; vartra </dt>
           <dd><em>v&#x00e1;rtra</em> mf(<em>&#x012b;</em>)n. keeping or warding off, protecting, defending &#x0100;&#x015b;vG&#x1e5b; </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; n. a dike, dam AV. TS</dd>

           <dt>vara 2</dt>
           <dd><em>var&#x00e1;</em> inf(<em>&#x0101;</em>)n. (fr. &#x221a;2. <em>v&#x1e5b;</em>) choosing ( <em>pati&#x1e43;-var&#x0101;</em>, <em>svaya&#x1e43;-var&#x0101;</em>) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; m. 'chooser', one who solicits a girl in marriage, suitor, lover, bridegroom, husband (rarely 'son-in-law') RV. &amp;c. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a bridegroom's friend MW </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a dissolute man (= <em>vita</em> or <em>&#x1e63;i&#x1e0d;ga</em>) L </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (<em>v&#x00e1;ra</em>), mf(<em>&#x0101;</em>)n. 'select', choicest, valuable, precious, best, most excellent or eminent among (gen., loc., abl., or comp.) or for (gen.) &#x015a;rS. MBh. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (ifc.) royal, princely J&#x0101;takam </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; better, preferable, better than (abl., rarely gen.) or among (abl.) Mn. MBh. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; eldest W </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (<em>am</em>), ind. (g. <em>svar-&#x0101;di</em>) preferably, rather, better (also = preferable, sometimes with abl. which in Veda is often followed by <em>&#x0101;</em> e.g. <em>agn&#x00ed;bhyo v&#x00e1;ram</em>, 'better than fires' RV </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>s&#x00e1;kkibhya &#x0101;&#x0341; v&#x00e1;ram</em>, 'better than companions' ib </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; exceptionally with acc., e.g. <em>&#x015b;i&#x1e63;yai&#x1e25; &#x015b;ata-hut&#x0101;n hom&#x0101;n</em>, <em>eka&#x1e25; putra-kut varam</em>, 'better one sacrifice offered by a son than a hundred offered by disciples' &#x1e62;a&#x1e0d;vBr.) RV. &amp;c. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; it is better that, it would be best if (with pres. e.g. <em>vara&#x1e43; gacch&#x0101;mi</em>, 'it is better that I go' </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; or with Impv., e.g. <em>vara&#x1e43; naye sth&#x0101;pyat&#x0101;m</em>, 'it would be better if he were initiated into our plan' Kath&#x0101;s </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; or without any verb, e.g. <em>vara&#x1e43; si&#x1e43;h&#x0101;t</em>, 'better <em>death caused</em> by a lion' Pa&#x00f1;cat </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; sometimes with Pot., e. <em>vara&#x1e43; tat kury&#x0101;t</em>, 'better that he should do that K&#x0101;m.) K&#x0101;v. Kath&#x0101;s. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; it is better than, rather than (in these senses <em>varam</em> is followed by, <em>na</em>, <em>na ca</em> <em>na tu</em>, <em>na puna&#x1e25;</em> <em>tad api na</em> or <em>tath&#x00e2;pi na</em>, with nom., e.g. <em>vara&#x1e43; m&#x1e5b;&#x015b;yur nac&#x00e2;k&#x012b;rti&#x1e25;</em>, 'better death than [lit. 'and not'] infamy' </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; exeptionally with instr., e.g. <em>varam eko gu&#x1e47;&#x012b; putro ta ca m&#x016b;rkha-&#x015b;atair api</em>, 'better one virtuous son than hundreds of fools' Hit </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>na hi-varam</em>, 'by no mean - but rather') Mn. MBh. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; m. (rarely n </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; ifc. f. <em>&#x0101;</em>) 'act or object of choosing, election, wish, request </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; boon, gift, reward, benefit, blessing, favour (<em>v&#x00e1;r&#x0101;ya</em>, <em>v&#x00e1;ram &#x0101;&#x0341;</em>, <em>pr&#x00e1;ti v&#x00e1;ram</em> or <em>v&#x00e1;ra&#x1e43; varam</em>, 'according to wish, to one's heart's content' </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>mad-var&#x0101;t</em>, in consequence of the boon granted by me' </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>v&#x00e1;ra&#x1e43;-&#x221a;v&#x1e5b;</em>, to choose a boon' </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>vara&#x1e43;-&#x221a;y&#x0101;c</em> or <em>&#x0101;-&#x221a;k&#x0101;&#x1e45;k&#x1e63;</em> or &#x221a;<em>br&#x016b;</em> or Caus. of <em>pra-&#x221a;arth</em>, 'to prefer a request' </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>v&#x00e1;ra&#x1e43;&#x221a;d&#x0101;</em>, 'to grant a boon or blessing' </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>varam pra-&#x221a;d&#x0101;</em> or <em>pra-&#x221a;yam</em> id </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>vara&#x1e43;-&#x221a;labh</em>, to receive a boon or reward') RV. &amp;c. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a benefit, advantage, privilege Da&#x015b; </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; charity, alms VarB&#x1e5b;S </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a dowry Pa&#x00f1;cat </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; m. a kind of grain (= <em>varata</em>) K&#x0101;ty&#x015a;r. Sch </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; bdellium L </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a sparrow L </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; N. of a son of &#x015a;vaphalka VP </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (<em>&#x0101;</em>), f. N. of various plants and vegetable products (accord. to L. 'the three kinds of myrobolan' </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; Clypea Hemandifolia </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; Asparagus Racemosus </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; Cocculus Cordifolius </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; turmeric </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; Embelia Ribes </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a &#x221a;similar to ginger </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; = <em>br&#x0101;hrn&#x012b;</em> and <em>re&#x1e47;uk&#x0101;</em>) Su&#x015b;r </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; N. of P&#x0101;rvat&#x012b; L </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; N. of a river BhP </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (<em>&#x012b;</em>), f. Asparagus Racemosus L </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; N. of Ch&#x0101;ya (the wife of S&#x016b;rya) L </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; n. saffron BhP. (In comp. not always separable from 1. <em>vara</em>.)</dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; varakaly&#x0101;&#x1e47;a </dt>

           <dt>&#x22d9; varada </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x25cb;d&#x00e1;</em> mf(<em>&#x0101;&#x0341;</em>)n. granting wishes, conferring a boon, ready to fulfil requests or answer prayers (said of gods and men) AV. &#x015a;vetUp. T&#x0100;r. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; m. a benefactor W </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; N. of Agni in &#x015a;&#x0101;ntika G&#x1e5b;ihy&#x0101;s </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; fire for burnt offerings of a propitiatory character W </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; N. of one of Skanda's attendants MBh </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; of a partic. class of deceased ancestors M&#x0101;rkP </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; of a partic. Sam&#x0101;dhi K&#x0101;ra&#x1e47;&#x1e0d; </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; of one of the 7 Rishis in the 4th Manv-antara VP </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; of a Dhy&#x0101;ni-buddha W </dd>

           <dd><em>v&#x00e1;rga</em> (accented only in Nigh.), m. (fr. &#x221a;<em>v&#x1e5b;j</em>) one who excludes or removes or averts KaushUp </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (ifc. f. <em>&#x0101;</em>) a separate division, class, set, multitude of similar things (animate or inanimate), group, company, family, party, side (mostly ifc., e.g. <em>catur-</em>, <em>tri-v&#x25cb;</em>, q.v </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; often pl. for sg.) K&#x0101;ty&#x015a;r. Pr&#x0101;t. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (esp.) any series or group of words classified together (as <em>manu&#x1e63;ya-vanas-pati-v&#x25cb;</em> &amp;c.), or a class or series of consonants in the alphabet (seven such classes being given, viz. <em>ka-varga</em>, 'the class of Guttural letters <em>ca-k&#x0101;ra-v&#x25cb;</em>, or <em>ca-v&#x25cb;</em>, 'the Palatals' <font color="#FF0000" font size=-2><a name="p924-1"></a>[Page 924, Column 1]</font> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>&#x1e6d;a-v&#x25cb;</em> 'the Cerebrals' </dd>

           <dd>&#x2022; <em>pa-v&#x25cb;</em> 'the Labials' </dd>

           <dd>&#x2022; <em>&#x015b;a-v&#x25cb;</em> 'the Sibilants', and the aspirate h, cf. <em>varga-dvit&#x012b;ya</em> and <em>-prathama</em>) Pr&#x0101;t. VarB&#x1e5b;S. Vop </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; everything comprehended under any department or head, everything included under a category, province or sphere of. VarB&#x1e5b;S </dd>

           <dd>&#x2022; a section, chapter, division of a book, (esp.) a subdivision of an Adhy&#x0101;ya in the &#x1e5a;ig-veda (which, accord. to the mere mechanical division, contains 8 Ashtakas or 64 Adhy&#x012b;yas or 2006 Vargas </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; cf. <em>ma&#x1e47;&#x1e0d;ala</em>) and a similar subdivision in the B&#x1e5b;ihad-devat&#x0101; </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (in alg.) the square of a number Col. (e.g. <em>pa&#x00f1;ca-v&#x25cb;</em>, square of five, cf. <em>bhinna-v&#x25cb;</em>) </dd>

           <dd>&#x2022; neglect Pa&#x00f1;car </dd>

           <dt>var&#x1e63;a </dt>
           <dd><em>var&#x1e63;&#x00e1;</em> mf(<em>&#x0101;</em>)n. (fr. &#x221a;<em>v&#x1e5b;&#x1e63;</em>) raining (ifc., e.g. <em>k&#x0101;ma-v&#x25cb;</em>, raining according to one's wish) BhP </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; m. and (older) n. (ifc. f. <em>&#x0101;</em>) rain, raining, a shower (either 'of rain', or fig. 'of flowers, arrows, dust &amp;c.' </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; also applied to seminal effusion) RV. &amp;c. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (pl.) the rains AV. (cf. <em>var&#x1e63;&#x0101;</em> f.) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a cloud L </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a year (commonly applied to age) Br. &amp;c. &amp;c. (<em>&#x0101; var&#x1e63;&#x0101;t</em>, for a whole year </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>var&#x1e63;&#x0101;t</em>, after a year </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>var&#x1e63;e&#x1e47;a</em> within a year </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>var&#x1e63;e</em> every year) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a day (?) R. vii, 73, 5 (Sch.) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a division of the earth as separated off by certain mountain ranges (9 such divisions are enumerated, viz. Kuru, Hira&#x1e47;maya, Ramyaka, Il&#x00e2;v&#x1e5b;ita, Hari </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; Ketu-m&#x0101;l&#x0101;, Bhadr&#x00e2;&#x015b;iva. Kimnara, and Bh&#x0101;rata' </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; sometimes the number given is 7) MBh. Pur. (cf. IW. 420) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; India (= <em>bh&#x0101;ratavar&#x1e63;a</em> and <em>jambu-dviipa</em>) L </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; m. N. of a grammarian Kath&#x0101;s </dd>

           <dt>val </dt>
           <dd><em>val</em> (cf. &#x221a;<em>bal</em>, <em>vall</em>, and <em>v&#x1e5b;</em>), cl. 1. &#x0100;. (Dh&#x0101;tup. xiv, 20) <em>valate</em> (oftener P. <em>valati</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Vam">Vam.</a> v, 2, 3 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; pf. <em>vavale</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; ind. p. <em>valitv&#x0101;</em> K&#x0101;v </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; aor. <em>avali&#x1e63;&#x1e6d;a</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; fut. <em>valit&#x0101;</em> &amp;c., Gr.), to turn, turn round, turn to (with <em>abhimukham</em> and acc., or loc.) K&#x0101;v. Kath&#x0101;s. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to be drawn or attached towards, be attached to (loc.) Nal&#x00f4;d. G&#x012b;t </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to move to and fro Hcat </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to go, approach, hasten Mcar. &#x015a;i&#x015b; </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to return i.e. come back or home Uttamac </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to return i.e. depart or go away again ib. HPari&#x015b; </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to break forth, appear G&#x012b;t </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to increase S&#x0101;h </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to cover or enclose or to be covered (cf. &#x221a;1. <em>v&#x1e5b;</em>) L.: Caus. <em>valayati</em> or <em>v&#x0101;layati</em> (Dh&#x0101;tup. xix, 58 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; aor. <em>aviivalat</em>), to cause to move or turn or roll &#x015a;i&#x015b;. HPari&#x015b;. Naish. Sch </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to cherish &amp;c. W. (rather <em>b&#x0101;layati</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; See &#x221a;2 <em>bal</em>): Desid. of Caus. in <em>viv&#x0101;layi&#x1e63;u</em>, q.v</dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; vallabh&#x0101;c&#x0101;rya </dt>
           <dd><em>vallabh&#x00e2;c&#x0101;rya</em> m. N. of a celebrated Vaish&#x1e47;ava teacher (successor of a less celebrated teacher Vish&#x1e47;usv&#x0101;min </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; he was born, it is said, in the forest of Camp&#x00e2;ra&#x1e47;ya in 1479 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; at an early age he travelling to propagate his doctrines, and at the court of K&#x1e5b;ish&#x1e47;adeva, king of Vijaya-nagara, succeeded so well in his controversies with the &#x015a;aivas that the Vaish&#x1e47;avas chose him as their chief </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; he then went to other parts of India, and finally settled down at Benares, where he composed seventeen works, the most important of which were a commentary on the Ved&#x00e2;nta and M&#x012b;m&#x0101;&#x1e43;s&#x0101; S&#x016b;tras and another on the Bh&#x0101;gavata. Pur&#x0101;&#x1e47;a, on which last the sect rest their doctrines </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; he left behind eighty-four disciples, of each of whom some story is told, and these stories are often repeated on festive occasions. He taught a non-ascetical view of religion and deprecated all self-mortification as dishonouring the body which contained a portion of the supreme Spirit. His followers in Bombay and Gujarat, and their leaders, are called Mah&#x0101;-r&#x0101;jas </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; they are called the epicureans of India) RTL. 134-137 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>-va&#x1e43;&#x015b;&#x00e2;val&#x012b;</em> f. N. of wk</dd>

           <dt>va&#x015b; </dt>
           <dd><em>va&#x015b;</em> cl. 2. P. (Dh&#x0101;tup. xxiv, 71) <em>v&#x00e1;&#x1e63;&#x1e6d;i</em>, (1. pl. <em>u&#x015b;m&#x00e1;si</em>, or <em>&#x015b;masi</em> RV </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; 3. pl. <em>u&#x015b;&#x00e1;nti</em> ib </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; p. <em>u&#x015b;&#x00e1;t</em>, <em>u&#x015b;&#x0101;n&#x00e1;</em> and <em>u&#x015b;&#x00e1;m&#x0101;na</em> ib </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; cl. 1. <em>v&#x00e1;&#x015b;ati</em> and cl. 3. <em>viva&#x1e63;&#x1e6d;i</em> [also <em>vav&#x00e1;&#x1e63;&#x1e6d;i</em>], 2. sg. <em>vav&#x00e1;k&#x1e63;i</em> ib </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; pf. <em>v&#x0101;va&#x015b;&#x00fa;&#x1e25;</em>, <em>&#x25cb;&#x015b;e</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; p. <em>&#x25cb;&#x015b;&#x0101;n&#x00e1;</em> ib </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>uv&#x0101;&#x015b;a</em>, <em>&#x016b;&#x015b;u&#x1e25;</em> Gr </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; aor. [av˘AzIt] ib </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; 2. sg. <em>va&#x015b;&#x012b;h</em> MBh. Prec. <em>u&#x015b;y&#x0101;t</em> Gr </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; fut. <em>va&#x015b;it&#x0101;</em>, <em>&#x25cb;&#x015b;i&#x1e63;yati</em> ib.), to will, command (p. <em>u&#x015b;&#x00e1;m&#x0101;na</em>', having at command') RV. AV </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to desire, wish, long for, be fond of, like (also with inf.) RV. &amp;c. &amp;c. (p. <em>u&#x015b;&#x00e1;t</em> and <em>u&#x015b;&#x0101;n&#x00e1;</em>, 'willing, glad, eager, zealous, obedient' </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the former with superl. <em>u&#x015b;at-tama</em>, also = charming, lovely BhP. [accord&#x1e6d;o Sch. also = <em>&#x015b;uddha</em>, <em>ded&#x012b;pyam&#x0101;na</em>, and <em>sv-arcita</em>]) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to aver, maintain, affirm, declare for (two acc.) MaitrUp. VarB&#x1e5b;S. BhP.: Caus. <em>v&#x0101;&#x015b;ayati</em> (aor. <em>aviiva&#x015b;at</em>), to cause to desire &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to get in one's power, subject Cat.: Desid. <em>viva&#x015b;i&#x1e63;ati</em> Gr. Intens. <em>v&#x0101;va&#x015b;yate</em>, <em>v&#x0101;va&#x015b;&#x012b;ti</em>, or <em>v&#x0101;va&#x1e63;&#x1e6d;i</em> ib </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; p. <em>v&#x0101;va&#x015b;&#x0101;n&#x00e1;</em>, 'willing, eager' RV. [Cf. Gk. ?, for ?, 'willing.'] [page 929, 2] <font color="#FF0000" font size=-2><a name="p929-1"></a>[Page 929, Column 1]</font>
</dd>

           <dt>&#x226b; va&#x015b;a 1</dt>
           <dd><em>v&#x00e1;&#x015b;a</em> m. will, wish, desire RV. &amp;c. &amp;c. (also pl. <em>v&#x00e1;&#x015b;&#x0101;n &#x00e1;nu</em> or <em>&#x00e1;nu v&#x00e1;&#x015b;a</em>, 'according to wish or will, at pleasure') </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; authority, power, control, dominion (in AV. personified) ib. (acc. with verbs of going, e.g. with &#x221a;<em>i</em>, <em>anu-&#x221a;i</em>, &#x221a;<em>gam</em>, <em>&#x0101;-&#x221a;gam</em>, &#x221a;<em>ya</em>, <em>&#x0101;-&#x221a;pad</em>, <em>&#x0101;-&#x221a;sth&#x0101;</em> &amp;c., 'to fall into a person's <em>gen.</em> power, become subject or give way to' </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; acc. with &#x221a;<em>n&#x012b;</em>, <em>&#x0101;-&#x221a;n&#x012b;</em> and <em>pra-&#x221a;yuj</em>, or loc. with &#x221a;<em>k&#x1e5b;</em>, &#x221a;<em>labh</em> or Caus. of &#x221a;<em>sth&#x0101;</em> or <em>sa&#x1e43;-&#x221a;sth&#x0101;</em>, 'to reduce to subjection, subdue' </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; loc. with &#x221a;<em>bh&#x016b;</em>, &#x221a;<em>v&#x1e5b;t</em>, &#x221a;<em>sth&#x0101;</em> and <em>sa&#x1e43;-&#x221a;sth&#x0101;</em>, 'to be in a person's <em>gen.</em> power' </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>va&#x015b;ena</em>, <em>&#x25cb;&#x015b;&#x0101;t</em>, and <em>&#x25cb;&#x015b;a-ta&#x1e25;</em>, with gen. or ifc., 'by command of, by force of, on account of, by means of, according to') </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; birth, origin L </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a brothel L. (cf. <em>ve&#x015b;a</em>) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; Carissa Carandas L </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the son of a Vai&#x015b;ya and a Kara&#x1e47;&#x012b; L </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; N. of a &#x1e5a;ishi preserved by the A&#x015b;vins RV </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (with <em>a&#x015b;vya</em>) of the supposed author of RV. viii, 46 (in &#x015a;Br. &amp;c. also of this hymn itself) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; = <em>v&#x0101;lm&#x012b;ki</em> Gal </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; pl. N. of a people AitBr. MBh </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (<em>&#x0101;</em>), f. See below </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; mf(<em>&#x0101;</em>)n. willing, submissive, obedient, subject to or dependent on (gen.) Kath&#x0101;s. BhP. Pa&#x00f1;cat </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; docile L </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; free, licentious L</dd>

           <dt>&#x226b; va&#x015b;i 1</dt>
           <dd><em>va&#x015b;&#x00ed;</em> mfn. = <em>k&#x0101;nta</em> VS. (Mah&#x012b;dh.) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; m. subjugation, fascination, bewitching, holding others in magical submission to the will MW </dd>

           <dd><em>&#x25cb;t&#x0101;</em> f. subjugation, dominion W </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the supernatural power of subduing all to one's own will, unbounded power of (comp </dd>

           <dt>&#x226b; vasanta </dt>
           <dd><em>vasant&#x00e1;</em> m. (n., g. <em>ardharc&#x00e2;di</em>) 'brilliant (season)', spring (comprising, accord. to some, the months Ca&#x012b;ra and Vais&#x0101;kha or from the middle of March to that of May, See <em>&#x1e5b;tu</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; often personified and considered as a friend or attendant of K&#x0101;madeva, the god of love) RV. &amp;c. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a partic. metre (4 times ?) Col </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a partic. time (in music) L </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; diarrhoea L </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; N. of a man R&#x0101;jat</dd>

           <dt>&#x226b; vas&#x0101;vi </dt>

           <dt>&#x22d9; vas&#x0101;v&#x012b; </dt>
           <dd><em>vas&#x0101;&#x0341;&#x1e0d;v&#x012b;</em> f. (fr. z. <em>vasu</em>) a treasury RV. x, 73, 4</dd>

           <dt>&#x226b; vasin </dt>
           <dd><em>vasin</em> m. (fr. <em>vas&#x0101;</em>) an otter L</dd>

           <dt>&#x226b; vasi&#x1e63;&#x1e6d;ha </dt>
           <dd><em>v&#x00e1;si&#x1e63;&#x1e6d;ha</em> mfn. (superl. fr. 1. <em>v&#x00e1;su</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; cf. <em>v&#x00e1;s&#x012b;yas</em> and under &#x221a;3. <em>vas</em>) most excellent, best, richest RV. AV. Br. ChUp. MBh </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; m. (wrongly written <em>va&#x015b;i&#x1e63;&#x1e6d;ha</em>), 'the most wealthy', N. of a celebrated Vedic &#x1e5a;ishi or sage (owner of the 'cow of plenty', called Nandin&#x012b;, offspring of Surabhi, which by gransing all desires made him, as his name implies, master of every <em>vasu</em> or desirable object </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; he was the typical representative of Br&#x0101;hmanical rank, and the legends of his conflict with Vi&#x015b;v&#x0101;-mitra, who raised himself from the kingly or Kshatriya to the Br&#x0101;hmanical class, were probably founded on the actual struggles which took place between the Br&#x0101;hmans and Kshatriyas </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a great many hymns of the RV. are ascribed to these two great rivals </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; those of the seventh Ma&#x1e47;&#x1e0d;ala, besides some others, being attributed to Vasish&#x1e6d;ha, while those of the third Ma&#x1e47;&#x1e0d;ala are assigned to Vi&#x015b;v&#x0101;-mitra </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; in one of Vasishtha's hymns he is represented as king Su-d&#x0101;s' family priest, an office to which Vi&#x015b;v&#x0101;-mitra also aspired </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; in another hymn Vasish&#x1e6d;ha claims to have been inspired by Varu&#x1e47;a, and in another [RV. vii, 33, 11] he is called the son of the Apsaras Urva&#x015b;&#x012b; by Mitra and Varu&#x1e47;a, whence his patronymic Maitr&#x0101;varu&#x1e47;i <font color="#FF0000" font size=-2><a name="p930-3"></a>[Page 930, Column 3]</font> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; in Manu i, 35, he is enumerated among the ten Praj&#x0101;-patis or Patriarchs produced by Manu Sv&#x0101;yambhuva for the peopling of the universe </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; in the MBh. he is mentioned as the family priest of the solar race or family of Ikshv&#x0101;ku and R&#x0101;ma-candra, and in the Pur&#x0101;&#x1e47;as as one of the arrangers of the Vedas in the Dv&#x0101;para age </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; he is, moreover, called the father of Aurva <em>&#x1e25;ariv.</em>, of the Suk&#x0101;lins <em>&#x1e43;n.</em>, of seven sons <em>&#x1e25;ariv. Pur.</em>, and the husband of Aksha-m&#x0101;l&#x0101; or Arundhat&#x012b; <em>&#x1e43;Bh.</em> and of &#x016a;rj&#x0101; <em>Pur.</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; other legends make him one of the 7 patriarchal sages regarded as forming the Great Bear in which he represents the star ( See <em>&#x1e5b;&#x1e63;i</em>) RV. &amp;c. &amp;c. (cf. IW. 361 ; 402, n. 1 &amp;c.) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; N. of the author of a law-book and other wks. (prob. intended to be ascribed to the Vedic &#x1e5a;ishi above) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; pl. the family of Vasish&#x1e6d;ha RV. &#x015a;Br. &#x015a;rS. (<em>vasi&#x1e63;&#x1e6d;hasy&#x00e2;&#x1e45;ku&#x015b;a&#x1e25;</em> &amp;c., N. of S&#x0101;mans &#x0100;rshBr.) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; N. of an Anuv&#x0101;ka Pat. on P&#x0101;&#x1e47;. 4-3, 131 V&#x0101;rtt. 2 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; n. flesh Gal</dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; vasi&#x1e63;&#x1e6d;hak&#x0101;lpa </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x25cb;k&#x00e2;lpa</em> m. N. of wk</dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; vasi&#x1e63;&#x1e6d;haka&#x015b;yapik&#x0101; </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x25cb;ka&#x015b;yapik&#x0101;</em> f. a matrimonial alliance between the descendants of Vasishtha and those of Ka&#x015b;yapa Pat</dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; vasi&#x1e63;&#x1e6d;habh&#x1e5b;gvatrisama </dt>

           <dt>&#x226b; vas&#x012b;yas </dt>
           <dd><em>v&#x00e1;s&#x012b;yas</em> mfn. (compar. of 1. <em>v&#x00e1;su</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; cf. <em>vasi&#x1e63;&#x1e6d;ha</em> and <em>vasyas</em>) more wealthy or opulent, more excellent, better than, (abl.) TS. Br. Gobh</dd>

           <dt>&#x226b; vas&#x012b;yobh&#x016b;ra </dt>
           <dd><em>vas&#x012b;yo-bh&#x016b;ra</em> n. better condition, superiority MaitrS</dd>

           <dt>&#x226b; vasu 1</dt>
           <dd><em>v&#x00e1;su</em> mf(<em>u</em> or <em>vii</em>)n. (for 2. See p. 932, col. 3) excellent, good, beneficent RV. G&#x1e5b;&#x015a;rS </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; sweet L </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; dry L </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; N. of the gods (as the 'good or bright ones, esp. of the &#x0100;dityas, Maruts, A&#x015b;vins, Indra, Ushas, Rudra, V&#x0101;yu, Vish&#x1e47;u, &#x015a;iva, and Kubera) RV. AV. MBh. R </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; of a partic. class of gods (whose number is usually eight, and whose chief is Indra, later Agni and Vish&#x1e47;u </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; they form one of the nine Ga&#x1e47;as or classes enumerated under Ga&#x1e47;a-devat&#x0101;, q.v </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the eight Vasus were originally personifications, like other Vedic deities, of natural phenomena, and are usually mentioned with the other Ga&#x1e47;as common in the Veda, viz. the eleven Rudras and the twelve &#x0100;diyas, constituting with them and with Dyaus, Heaven, and P&#x1e5b;ithivii, 'Earth' [or, according to some, with Indra and Praj&#x0101;-pati, or, according to others, with the two A&#x015b;vins], the thirty-three gods to which reference is frequently made </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the names of the Vasus, according to the Vish&#x1e47;u-Pur&#x0101;&#x1e47;a, are, 1. &#x0100;pa [connected with <em>ap</em>', 'water'] </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; 2. Dhruva, 'the Pole-star </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; 3. Soma, 'the Moon' </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; 4. Dhava or Dhara </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; 5. Anila, 'Wind' </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; 6. Anala or P&#x0101;vaka, 'Fire' </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; 7. Pratyusha, 'the Dawn' </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; 8. Prabh&#x0101;sa, 'Light' </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; but their names are variously given </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; Ahan, 'Day', being sometimes substituted for 1 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; in their relationship to Fire and Light they appear to belong to Vedic rather than Pur&#x0101;nic mythology) RV. &amp;c. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a symbolical N. of the number 'eight' VarB&#x1e5b;S </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a ray of light Naigh. i, 15 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a partic. ray of light VP </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; = <em>jina</em> &#x015a;&#x012b;l. (only L. the sun </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the moon </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; fire </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a rope, thong </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a tree </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; N. of two kinds of plant = <em>baka</em> and <em>p&#x012b;ta-madgu</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a lake, pond </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a kind of fish </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the the of the yoke of a plough </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the distance from the elbow to the closed fist) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; N. of a Rishi (with the patr. Bharad-v&#x0101;ja, author of RV. ix, 80-82, reckoned among the seven sages) Hariv </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; of a son of Manu ib </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; of a son of Utt&#x0101;na-p&#x0101;da ib </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; of a prince of the Cedis also called Upari-cara MBh </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; of a son of &#x012a;lina ib </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; of a son of Ku&#x015b;a and the country called after him RV </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; of a son of Vasu-deva BhP </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; of a son of K&#x1e5b;ish&#x1e47;a ib </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; of a son of Vatsara ib </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; of a son of Hira&#x1e47;ya-retas and the Varsha ruled by him ib </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; of a son of Bh&#x016b;tajyotis ib </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; of a son of Naraka ib </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; of a king of Ka&#x015b;m&#x012b;ra Cat. <font color="#FF0000" font size=-2><a name="p931-1"></a>[Page 931, Column 1]</font> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (<em>u</em>), f. light, radiance L </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a partic. drug L </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; N. of a daughter of Daksha and mother of the Vasus (as a class of gods) Hariv. VP.: (<em>vii</em>), f. night Naigh. i, 7 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; n. (in Veda gen. <em>v&#x00e1;sos</em>, <em>v&#x00e1;svas</em> and <em>v&#x00e1;sunas</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; also pl., exceptionally m.) wealth, goods, riches, property RV. &amp;c. &amp;c. (<em>vaso&#x1e63;-pati</em> m. prob. 'the god of wealth or property' AV. i, 12 [Paipp. <em>aso&#x1e63;-p&#x25cb;</em>, 'the god of life'] </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>v&#x00e1;sor-dh&#x0101;&#x0341;r&#x0101;</em> f. 'stream of wealth', N. of a partic. libation of Gh&#x1e5b;ita at the Agni-cayana AV. TS. Br. &amp;c </dd>

           <dd><em>&#x016b;&#x1e0d;haya</em> Nom. P. <em>&#x25cb;yati</em> (fr. <em>&#x016b;&#x1e0d;ha</em> and <em>&#x016b;&#x1e0d;hi</em>) K&#x0101;&#x015b;. on P&#x0101;&#x1e47;. 8-2, 1</dd>

           <dt>&#x226b; &#x016b;&#x1e0d;hi </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x016b;&#x1e0d;hi</em> f. bearing, carrying, bringing R&#x0101;jat</dd>

           <dt>&#x226b; vah 2</dt>
           <dd><em>vah</em> (ifc </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; strong form <em>v&#x0101;h</em> weak form [˘Uk], which with a preceding <em>a</em> coalesces into <em>au</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#P&#x0101;&#x1e47;">P&#x0101;&#x1e47;.</a> 3-2, 64 ; iv, 1, 61) carrying, drawing, bearing, holding (cf. <em>ana&#x1e0d;-uh</em>, <em>apsu-vah</em>, <em>indra-vah</em> &amp;c.)</dd>

           <dt>&#x226b; vaha </dt>
           <dd><em>v&#x00e1;ha</em> mf(<em>&#x0101;</em>)n. (ifc.) carrying, bearing, conveying, bringing, causing, producing, effecting (cf. <em>gandha-</em>, <em>d&#x0101;ru-</em>, <em>pu&#x1e47;ya-v&#x25cb;</em> &amp;c.) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; flowing through or into or towards (cf. <em>para-loka-v&#x25cb;</em>, <em>sarva-loka-v&#x25cb;</em> &amp;c.) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; bearing along (said of rivers) Hcat </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; bearing (a name) Kull. on Mn. iv, 203 (in a quotation) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; exposing one's self to (heat &amp;c.) MBh </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; m. the act of bearing or conveying (cf. <em>dur-</em>, <em>sukha-v&#x25cb;</em>) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the shoulder of an ox or any draught animal AV. VS. Br. MBh </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the shoulder-piece of a yoke AV. &#x015a;Br </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a horse L </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a male river L </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a road, way L </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; wind L </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the breathing of a cow L </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a weight or measure of four Dro&#x1e47;as L </dd>

           <dt>vahni </dt>
           <dd><em>vahni</em> &amp;c. See p. 933, col. 3</dd>

           <dt>vahli </dt>
           <dd><em>vahli</em> <em>vahlika</em> &amp;c. See <em>balhi</em></dd>

           <dt>v&#x0101; 1</dt>
           <dd><em>v&#x0101;</em> ind. or (excluded, like the Lat. <em>ve</em>, from the first place in a sentence, and generally immediately following, rarely and only m.c. preceding, the word to which it refers) RV. &amp;c. &amp;c. (often used in disjunctive sentences </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>v&#x0101;-v&#x0101;</em>, 'either'- 'or', 'on the one side '- 'on the other' </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>na v&#x0101;</em> - <em>v&#x0101;</em> or <em>na</em> - <em>v&#x0101;</em>, 'neither'- 'nor' </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>v&#x0101; na-v&#x0101;</em>, 'either not'-'or' </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>yadi v&#x0101;-v&#x0101;</em>, 'whether'-'or' </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; in a sentence containing more than two members <em>v&#x0101;</em> is nearly always repeated, although if a negative is in the first clause it need not be so repeated </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>v&#x0101;</em> is sometimes interchangeable with <em>ca</em> and <em>api</em>, and is frequently combined with other particles, esp. with <em>atha</em>, <em>ath&#x00f4;</em>, <em>uta</em>, <em>kim</em>, <em>yad</em>, <em>yadi</em>, q.v. [e.g. <em>atha v&#x0101;</em>, 'or else'] </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; it is also sometimes used as an expletive) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; either-or not, optionally K&#x0101;ty&#x015a;r. Mn. &amp;c. (in gram. <em>v&#x0101;</em> is used in a rule to denote its being optional, e.g. P&#x0101;&#x1e47;. 1-2, 13 ; 35 &amp;c.) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; as, like (= <em>iva</em>) P&#x0101;rG&#x1e5b;. MBh. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; just, even, indeed, very (= <em>eva</em>, laying stress on the preceding word) K&#x0101;ty&#x015a;r. K&#x0101;v </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; but even if, even supposing (followed by a future) Pa&#x00f1;c. v, 36/37 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; however, nevertheless B&#x0101;dar. B&#x0101;lar </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (after a rel. or interr.) possibly, perhaps, I dare say MBh. K&#x0101;v. &amp;c. (e.g. <em>ki&#x1e43; v&#x0101; &#x015b;akuntal&#x00ea;ty asya m&#x0101;tur &#x0101;khy&#x0101;</em>, 'is his mother's name perhaps &#x015a;akuntal&#x0101;?' &#x015a;ak. vii, 20/21 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>ko v&#x0101;</em> or <em>ke v&#x0101;</em> followed by a negative may in such cases be translated by 'every one, all', e.g. <em>ke v&#x0101; na syu&#x1e25; paribhava-pada&#x1e43; ni&#x1e63;phal&#x00e2;ram-bha-yatn&#x0101;&#x1e25;</em>, 'everybody whose efforts are fruitless is an object of contempt' Megh. 55)</dd>

           <dt>v&#x0101; 2</dt>
           <dd><em>v&#x0101;</em> cl. 2. P. (Dh&#x0101;tup. xxiv, 42) <em>v&#x0101;&#x0341;ti</em> (pf. <em>vavau</em> Br. MBh. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; aor. <em>av&#x0101;s&#x012b;t</em> Br </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; fut. <em>v&#x0101;syati</em> Megh </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; inf. <em>v&#x0101;tum</em> Hariv.), to blow (as the wind) RV. &amp;c. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to procure or bestow anything (acc.) by blowing RV. i, 89, 4 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to blow towards or upon (acc.) MBh. xii, 2798 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to emit an odour, be diffused (as perfume) &#x015a;Br </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to smell (trans.) Vikr. iv, 41 (v&#x1e37;.) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to hurt, injure Vop.: Caus. <em>v&#x0101;payati</em>, See <em>nir-&#x221a;v&#x0101;</em> and cf. <em>v&#x0101;jaya</em>: Desid. <em>viv&#x0101;sati</em>, See &#x221a;1. <em>van</em>. [Cf. Gk. ? for ? ; Lat. [934, 2] <em>ventus</em> ; Slav. <em>vejati</em> ; Goth. <em>waian</em>, <em>winds</em> ; Germ. <em>w&#x00e2;jan</em>, <em>woejen</em>, <em>wehen</em>, <em>Wind</em> ; Angl. Sax. <em>w&#x00e2;wan</em> ; Eng. <em>wind</em>.]</dd>

           <dt>&#x226b; v&#x0101;ta 1</dt>
           <dd><em>v&#x0101;ta</em> mfn. (for 2. See p. 939, col. 3) blown &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (<em>v&#x0101;&#x0341;ta</em>), m. wind or the wind-god (pl. also 'the Maruts', cf. <em>v&#x0101;yu</em>) RV. &amp;c. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; wind, air Hit </dd>

           <dt>v&#x0101;c </dt>
           <dd><em>v&#x0101;&#x0341;c</em> f. (fr. &#x221a;<em>vac</em>) speech, voice, talk, language (also of animals), sound (also of inanimate objects as of the stones used for pressing, of a drum &amp;c.) RV. &amp;c. &amp;c. (<em>v&#x0101;cam-&#x221a;&#x1e5b;</em>, <em>&#x012b;r</em>, or <em>i&#x1e63;</em>, to raise the voice, utter a sound, cry, call) </dd>

           <dd>&#x2022; Speech personified (in various manners or forms, e.g. as V&#x0101;c Ambh&#x1e5b;i&#x1e47;&#x012b; in RV. x, 125 ; as the voice of the middle sphere in Naigh. and Nir. ; in the Veda she is also represented as created by Praj&#x0101;-pati and married to him ; in other places she is called the mother of the Vedas and wife of Indra ; in VP. she is the daughter of Daksha and wife of Ka&#x015b;yapa ; but most frequently she is identified with Bh&#x0101;rat&#x012b; or Sarasvat&#x012b;, the goddess of speech </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>v&#x0101;ca&#x1e25; s&#x0101;ma</em> and <em>v&#x0101;co vratam</em>, N. of S&#x0101;mans &#x0100;rshBr </dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; v&#x0101;jasaneyag&#x1e5b;hyas&#x016b;tra </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x25cb;g&#x1e5b;hya-s&#x016b;tra</em> n</dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; v&#x0101;jasaneyapari&#x015b;i&#x1e63;&#x1e6d;anigama </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x25cb;pari&#x015b;i&#x1e63;&#x1e6d;a-nigama</em> m. N. of wks</dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; v&#x0101;jasaneyabr&#x0101;hma&#x1e47;a </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x25cb;br&#x0101;hma&#x1e47;a</em> n. the Br&#x0101;hma&#x1e47;a of the V&#x0101;jasaney&#x00e1;, i.e. the &#x015a;atapatha-br&#x0101;hma&#x1e47;a Kull</dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; v&#x0101;jasaneya&#x015b;&#x0101;kh&#x0101; </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x25cb;&#x015b;&#x0101;kh&#x0101;</em> f. the branch or school of the V&#x0101;jasaney&#x00e1; Inscr</dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; v&#x0101;jasaneyasa&#x1e43;hit&#x0101; </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x25cb;sa&#x1e43;hit&#x0101;</em> f. = <em>v&#x0101;jasaneyi-s&#x25cb;</em> Cat</dd>

           <dt>&#x226b; v&#x0101;jasaneyaka </dt>
           <dd><em>v&#x0101;jasaneyaka</em> mfn. belonging or relating to V&#x0101;jasaneya, devoted to him, composed by him &amp;c. &#x015a;rS. B&#x1e5b;&#x0100;rUp </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; n. N. of the &#x015a;Br. K&#x0101;ty&#x015a;r</dd>

           <dt>&#x226b; v&#x0101;jasaneyi </dt>
           <dd><em>v&#x0101;jasaneyi</em> in comp. for <em>&#x25cb;yin</em></dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; v&#x0101;jasaneyipr&#x0101;ti&#x015b;&#x0101;khya </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x25cb;pr&#x0101;ti&#x015b;&#x0101;khya</em> n. the Pr&#x0101;ti&#x015b;&#x0101;khya of the V&#x0101;jasaneyins</dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; v&#x0101;jasaneyibr&#x0101;hma&#x1e47;a </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x25cb;br&#x0101;hma&#x1e47;a</em> n. = <em>&#x015b;ata-patha-br&#x25cb;</em> (cf. above) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>&#x25cb;&#x1e47;&#x00f4;pani&#x1e63;ad</em> f. N. of an Upanishad</dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; v&#x0101;jasaneyi&#x015b;&#x0101;kh&#x0101; </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x25cb;&#x015b;&#x0101;kh&#x0101;</em> f. the branch or school of the V&#x0101;jasaneyins Cat</dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; v&#x0101;jasaneyisa&#x1e43;hit&#x0101; </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x25cb;sa&#x1e43;hit&#x0101;</em> f. the Sa&#x1e43;hit&#x0101; or continuous text of the V&#x0101;jasaneyins' (i.e. of the hymns of the White Yajur-veda ascribed to the &#x1e5a;ishi Y&#x0101;j&#x00f1;avalkya and called <em>&#x015b;ukla</em>, 'white', to distinguish it from the Black or Dark Yajur-veda, which was the name given to the Taittir&#x012b;ya-sa&#x1e43;hit&#x0101; <em>q.v.</em> of the Yajur-veda, because in this last, the separation between the Mantra and Br&#x0101;hma&#x1e47;a portion is obscured, and the two are blended together </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; whereas the White Sa&#x1e43;hit&#x0101; is clearly distinguished from the Br&#x0101;hma&#x1e47;a </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; it is divided into 40 Adhy&#x0101;yas with 303 Anuv&#x0101;kas, comprising 1975 sections or Ka&#x1e47;&#x1e0d;ik&#x0101;s the legend relates that the original Yajus was taught by the &#x1e5a;ishi Vai&#x015b;amp&#x0101;yana to his pupil Y&#x0101;j&#x00f1;avalkya, but the latter having incurred his teacher's anger was made to disgorge all the texts he had learnt, which were then picked up by Vai&#x015b;amp&#x0101;yana's other disciples in the form of partridges [see <em>taittir&#x012b;ya-sa&#x1e43;hit&#x0101;</em>] Y&#x0101;j&#x00f1;avalkya then hymned the Sun, who gratified by his homage, appeared in the form of a <em>v&#x0101;jin</em> or horse, and consented to give him fresh Yajus texts, which were not known to his former master </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; cf. <em>v&#x0101;jin</em>) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>&#x25cb;t&#x00f4;pani&#x1e63;ad</em> f. N. of an Upanishad (forming the 40th Adhy&#x0101;ya of the VS. and also called &#x012a;&#x015b;&#x0101; or &#x012a;&#x015b;&#x0101;-v&#x0101;syopanishad, q.v.)</dd>

           <dt>&#x226b; v&#x0101;jasaneyin </dt>

           <dd><em>v&#x0101;m&#x00e1;</em> mf(<em>&#x012b;&#x0341;</em> or <em>&#x0101;</em>)n. (fr. &#x221a;1. <em>van</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; for 1. See col. 1) lovely, dear, pleasant, agreeable, fair, beautiful, splendid, noble RV. &amp;c. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (ifc.) striving after, eager for, intent upon, fond of K&#x0101;v. Kath&#x0101;s. R&#x0101;jat </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; m. the female breast L </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the god of love L </dd>

           <dd>&#x2022; of a son of &#x1e5a;ic&#x012b;ka MBh. (B. <em>r&#x0101;ma</em>) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; of a son of K&#x1e5b;ish&#x1e47;a and Bhadr&#x0101; BhP </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; of a prince (son of Dharma) Cat </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; of a son of Bha&#x1e6d;&#x1e6d;a-n&#x0101;r&#x0101;ya&#x1e47;a Kshit&#x00ee;&#x015b;. (cf. <em>-deva</em>) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; of one of the Moon's horses VP </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; m. or n. a kind of pot-herb, Chenopodium Album L </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (<em>&#x0101;</em>), f. a beautiful woman, any woman or wife Pa&#x00f1;car. S&#x0101;h </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a partic. form of Durg&#x0101; Pur </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a partic. &#x015a;akti Hcat </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; N. of Lakshm&#x012b; W </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; of Sarasvat&#x012b; ib </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; of one of the M&#x0101;t&#x1e5b;is attending on Skanda MBh </dd>

           <dd>&#x2022; (<em>&#x00e1;y&#x0101;</em>), ind. in a pleasant or lovely manner RV. viii, 9, 7 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (<em>&#x012b;</em>), f. a mare L. (<em>v&#x0101;m&#x012b;-ratha</em> mfn. Pat. on P&#x0101;&#x1e47;. 4-2, 104 V&#x0101;rtt. 20) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a she-ass L </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a female camel (cf. <em>u&#x1e63;&#x1e6d;ra-v&#x25cb;</em>) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a young female elephant L </dd>

           <dd><em>v&#x0101;yas&#x012b;</em> in comp. for <em>v&#x0101;yasa</em></dd>

           <dd><em>&#x25cb;k&#x1e5b;ta</em> mfn. turned into a crow Subh</dd>

           <dd><em>v&#x0101;ysolik&#x0101;</em> or f. a medicinal &#x221a;(= <em>k&#x0101;kol&#x012b;</em>) Bhpr</dd>

           <dt>v&#x0101;yaska </dt>
           <dd><em>v&#x0101;yaska</em> U&#x1e47;. ; iv, 188 Sch</dd>

           <dt>v&#x0101;yu 1</dt>
           <dd><em>v&#x0101;y&#x00fa;</em> m. (fr. &#x221a;2. <em>v&#x0101;</em>) wind, air (as one of the 5 elements </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; in MBh. 7 winds are reckoned) RV. &amp;c. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the god of the wind (often associated with Indra in the &#x1e5a;ig-veda, as V&#x0101;ta <em>q.v.</em> with Parjanya, but although of equal rank with Indra, not occupying so prominent a position </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; in the Purushas&#x00fb;kta he is said to have sprung form the breath of Purusha, and elsewhere is described as the son-in-law of Tvash&#x1e6d;&#x1e5b;i </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; be is said to move in a shining car drawn by a pair of red or purple horses or by several teams consisting of ninety-nine or a hundred or even a thousand horses [cf. <em>ni-y&#x00fa;t</em>] </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; he is often made to occupy the same chariot with Indra, and in conjunction with him honoured with the first draught of the Soma libation </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; he is rarely connected with the Maruts, although in i, 134, 4, he is said to have begotten them from the rivers of heaven </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; he is regent of the Nakshatra Sv&#x0101;ti and north-west quarter, <em>loka-p&#x0101;la</em>) ib </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; breathing, breath VPr&#x0101;t &#x012a;&#x015b;Up </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the wind of the body, a vital air (of which 5 are reckoned, viz. <em>pr&#x00e2;&#x1e47;a</em>, <em>ap&#x00e2;na</em>, <em>sam&#x0101;na</em>, <em>ud&#x0101;na</em>, and <em>vy&#x0101;na</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; or <em>n&#x0101;ga</em>, <em>k&#x016b;rma</em>, <em>k&#x1e5b;kara</em>, <em>devadatta</em>, and <em>dhana&#x1e43;-jaya</em>) Hariv. S&#x0101;&#x1e43;khyak. Ved&#x00e2;ntas </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (in medicine) the windy humour or any morbid affection of it Su&#x015b;r </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the wind as a kind of demon producing madness K&#x0101;d. Vcar. (cf. <em>-grasta</em>) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (in astron.) N. of the fourth Muh&#x016b;rta </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a mystical N. of the letter <em>ya</em> Up </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; N. of a Vasu Hariv </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; of a Daitya ib </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; of a king of the Gandharvas VP </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; of a Marut R </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; pl. the Maruts Kath&#x0101;s. M&#x0101;rkP</dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; v&#x0101;yuk&#x1e5b;tsna </dt>

           <dt>v&#x0101;ra 2</dt>

           <dd>&#x2022; <em>bh&#x016b;ribhir v&#x0101;rai&#x1e25;</em> or <em>bh&#x016b;ri-v&#x0101;r&#x0101;n</em> or <em>bahu-v&#x0101;ram</em> or <em>v&#x0101;ra&#x1e43; v&#x0101;ram</em> or <em>v&#x0101;ra&#x1e43; v&#x0101;re&#x1e47;a</em>, many times, often, repeatedly) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the turn of a day (under the regency of a planet), a day of the week (they are &#x0100;ditya-, Soma-, Ma&#x1e45;gala-, Budha-, Guru., &#x015a;ukra-, and &#x015a;ani-v&#x1e6d;v&#x0101;ra </dd>

           <dd>&#x2022; a moment, occasion, opportunity W </dd>

           <dd><em>v&#x0101;rtt&#x0101;</em> f. livelihood, business, profession (esp. that of a Vai&#x015b;ya, i.e. agriculture, breeding of cattle, and trade </dd>

           <dd>&#x2022; (sometimes pl.) an account of anything that has happened, tidings, report, rumour, news, intelligence, story of or about (gen. or comp.) K&#x0101;v. Kath&#x0101;s. &amp;c.            <dd>&#x2022; <em>k&#x0101; v&#x0101;rtt&#x0101;</em>, 'what is the news?') </dd>

           <dd>&#x2022; <em>anay&#x0101; v&#x0101;rttay&#x00e2;pi ki&#x1e43; k&#x0101;ryam</em>, 'what is to be done with her even in mere words?') the mere mention of facts without poetical embellishment (in rhet.) MW </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; staying, abiding W </dd>

           <dt>&#x226b; v&#x0101;rttika </dt>
           <dd><em>v&#x0101;rttika</em> mfn. (fr. <em>v&#x0101;rtt&#x0101;</em> and <em>v&#x1e5b;tti</em>) skilled in a profession or business (= <em>v&#x1e5b;ttau s&#x0101;dhu&#x1e25;</em> or <em>v&#x1e5b;ttim adh&#x012b;7te veda v&#x0101;</em>), g. <em>kath&#x00e2;di</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; and g. <em>ukth&#x00e2;di</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; relating to news, bringing or conveying intelligence W </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; explanatory, glossarial, containing or relating to a critical gloss or annotation ( See n.) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; m. a businessman, trader Kath&#x0101;s </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; an emissary, envoy MBh </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; one who knows antidotes, conjurer, physician L </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the egg-plant L </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (<em>&#x0101;</em>), f. business, trade (ifc. = occupied with, practising) MBh. BhP </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a sort of quail (prob. w&#x1e5b;. for <em>v&#x0101;rtik&#x0101;</em>, q.v.) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; n. an explanatory or supplementary rule, critical gloss or annotation (added to a grammatical or philosophical S&#x016b;tra and defined to be 'the exposition of the meaning, of that which is said, of that which is left unsaid, and of that which is ill or imperfectly said' </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the term V&#x0101;rttika is, however, especially applied to K&#x0101;ty&#x0101;yana's critical annotations on the aphorisms of P&#x0101;&#x1e47;ini's grammar, the object of which is to consider whether P&#x0101;&#x1e47;ini's rules are correct or not, and to improve on them where this may be found to be necessary </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; and also to similar works on various matters by Kum&#x0101;rila, Sur&#x00ea;&#x015b;vara &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; cf. <em>tantra-v&#x25cb;</em>, <em>&#x015b;loka-v&#x25cb;</em>) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a marriage feast L</dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; v&#x0101;rttikak&#x0101;ra </dt>

           <dd>&#x2022; of a poet ib</dd>

           <dt>v&#x0101;rtra </dt>

           <dt>&#x226b; v&#x0101;lm&#x012b;ki </dt>
           <dd><em>v&#x0101;lm&#x012b;ki</em> m. (incorrectly <em>v&#x0101;lmiki</em>) N. of the celebrated author of the R&#x0101;m&#x00e2;ya&#x1e47;a (so called, according to some, because when immersed in thought he allowed himself to be overrun with ants like an anthill </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; he was no doubt a Br&#x0101;hman by birth and closely connected with the kings of Ayodhy&#x0101; </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; he collected the different songs and legendary tales relating to R&#x0101;ma-candra and welded them into one continuous poem, to which later additions may have been made </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; he is said to have invented the &#x015a;loka metre, and probably the language and style of Indian epic poetry owe their definite form to him </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; according to one tradition he began life as a robber, but repenting be took himself to a hermitage on a hill in the district of Banda in Bundelkund, where he eventually received S&#x012b;t&#x0101;, the wife of R&#x0101;ma, when banished by her husband </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#IW">IW.</a> 314 ; 315 &amp;c.) MBh. R. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; of a son of Garu&#x1e0d;a MBh </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; of a grammarian TPr&#x0101;t </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; of the authors of various wks. (the Yoga-v&#x0101;sish&#x1e6d;ha, the Adbhuta-r&#x0101;m&#x00e2;ya&#x1e47;a, and the Ga&#x1e45;gash&#x1e6d;aka) Cat </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (with <em>kavi</em>) of the son of Rudra-ma&#x1e47;i Tri-p&#x0101;&#x1e6d;hin and author of the Ramal&#x00ea;ndu-prak&#x0101;&#x015b;a ib</dd>

           <dd>&#x2022; being in the spring of life, young W </dd>

           <dd><em>v&#x0101;hyask&#x0101;yana</em> m. patr. fr. <em>v&#x0101;hyaska</em> g. <em>harit&#x00e2;di</em></dd>
