           <dt>vi 1</dt>
           <dd><em>v&#x00ed;</em> m. (nom. <em>v&#x00ed;s</em> or <em>v&#x00e9;s</em> acc. <em>v&#x00ed;m</em> gen. abl. <em>v&#x00e9;s</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; pl. nom. acc. <em>v&#x00e1;yas</em> [acc. <em>viin</em> Bha&#x1e6d;&#x1e6d;.] </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>v&#x00ed;bhis</em>, <em>v&#x00ed;bhyas</em>, <em>viin&#x0101;&#x0341;m</em>) a bird (also applied to horses, arrows, and the Maruts) RV. VS. Pa&#x00f1;cavBr, (also occurring in later language). [Cf. 1. <em>v&#x00e1;yas</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; Gk. ? for ? ; Lat. <em>a-vis</em> ; accord. to [949, 3] some Germ. <em>Ei</em> ; Angl. Sax. <em>a&#x00e9;g</em> ; Eng. <em>egg.</em> ] - 1</dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; vigata </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x25cb;gata</em> n. (for 2. See under <em>vi-&#x221a;gam</em>) the flight of birds MW. - 1</dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; vicch&#x0101;ya </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x25cb;cch&#x0101;ya</em> n. (for 2. See p. 950, col. 2) the shadow of a flock of birds L. (also <em>&#x0101;</em> f. BhP.)</dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; vipatman </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x25cb;patman</em> (<em>v&#x00ed;-</em>), mfn. having the flight of (i. e. flying as fast as) a bird RV. i, 180, 2. - 1</dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; vir&#x0101;j </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x25cb;r&#x0101;j</em> m. (for 2. See s.v.) king of birds BhP</dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; viva </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x25cb;va</em> mfn. (said to be fr. &#x221a;<em>v&#x0101;</em>, <em>v&#x0101;ti</em> = <em>gacchati</em>) riding on a bird &#x015a;i&#x015b;. xix, 86</dd>

           <dt>vi 2</dt>
           <dd><em>vi</em> n. an artificial word said to be = <em>anna</em> &#x015a;Br</dd>

           <dt>vi 3</dt>
           <dd><em>v&#x00ed;</em> ind. (prob. for an original <em>dvi</em>, meaning 'in two parts' </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; and opp. to <em>sam</em>, q.v.) apart, asunder, in different directions, to and fro, about, away, away from, off, without RV. &amp;c. &amp;c. In RV. it appears also as a prep. with acc. denoting 'through' or 'between' (with ellipse of the verb, e.g. i, 181, 5 ; x, 86, 20 &amp;c.) It is esp. used as a prefix to verbs or nouns and other parts of speech derived from verbs, to express 'division', 'distinction', 'distribution', 'arrangement', 'order', 'opposition', or 'deliberation' (cf. <em>vi-&#x221a;bhid</em>, <em>-&#x015b;i&#x1e63;</em>, <em>-dh&#x0101;</em>, <em>-rudh</em>, <em>-car</em>, with their nominal derivatives) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; sometimes it gives a meaning opposite to the idea contained in the simple &#x221a;(e.g. &#x221a;<em>kr&#x012b;</em>, 'to buy' </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>vi-&#x221a;kr&#x012b;</em>, 'to sell'), or it intensifies that idea (e.g. &#x221a;<em>hi&#x1e43;s</em>, 'to injure' </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>vi-&#x221a;hi&#x1e43;s</em>, 'to injure severely'). The above 3. <em>v&#x00ed;</em> may also be used in forming compounds not immediately referable to verbs, in which cases it may express 'difference' (cf. 1. <em>vi-lak&#x1e63;a&#x1e47;a</em>), 'change' or 'variety' (cf. <em>vi-citra</em>), 'intensity' (cf. <em>vi-kar&#x0101;la</em>), 'manifoldness' (cf. <em>vi-vidha</em>), 'contrariety' (cf. <em>vi-loma</em>), 'deviation from right' (cf. <em>vi-&#x015b;&#x012b;la</em>), 'negation' or 'privatlon' (cf. <em>vi-kaccha</em>, being often used like 3. <em>a</em>, <em>nir</em>, and <em>nis</em> <em>qq. vv.</em>, and like the Latin <em>dis</em>, <em>se</em>, and the English <em>a</em>, <em>dis</em>, <em>in</em>, <em>un</em> &amp;c.) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; in some cases it does not seem to modify the meaning of the simple word at all (cf. <em>vi-j&#x0101;mi</em>, <em>vi-j&#x0101;m&#x0101;t&#x1e5b;</em>) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; it is also used to form proper names out of other proper names (e.g. <em>vi-koka</em>, <em>vi-p&#x1e5b;thu</em>, <em>vi-vi&#x1e43;&#x015b;a</em>). To save space such words are here mostly collected under one article </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; but words having several subordinate compounds will be found s.v</dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; vika&#x1e43;s&#x0101; </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x25cb;ka&#x1e43;s&#x0101;</em> f. N. of a woman, g. <em>&#x015b;ubhr&#x00e2;di</em> (v. l.)</dd>

           <dt>vikatth </dt>

           <dd><em>vi-kara</em> m. (for 1. See p. 950, col. 1 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; for 3. See <em>vi-&#x221a;k&#x1e5d;</em>) disease, sickness L </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a partic. mode of fighting Hariv. (v. l. <em>vi&#x1e63;kara</em>)</dd>

           <dt>&#x226b; vikara&#x1e47;a 2</dt>
           <dd><em>vi-kara&#x1e47;a</em> m. (for 1. See p. 950, col. 1) 'producing a change.' (in gram.) a term for the affix or conjugational characteristic which is placed between the &#x221a;and terminations, the inserted conjugational affix (according to P&#x0101;&#x1e47;ini these affixes are <em>&#x015b;ap</em>, <em>&#x015b;apo luk</em>, <em>&#x015b;lu</em>, <em>&#x015b;yan</em>, <em>&#x015b;nu</em>, <em>&#x015b;a</em>, <em>&#x015b;nam</em>, <em>u</em>, <em>&#x015b;n&#x0101;</em>, <em>yak</em>, and <em>cli</em> <em>with its substitutes</em>, <em>t&#x0101;si</em>, <em>sya</em>, <em>sip</em>, the first nine of which are added in the Pres., Impf., Imperative, and Potential, and before a K&#x1e5b;it which contains a mute palatal <em>&#x015b;</em>, in the case of Active verbs </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>yak</em> is added in the case of the Karman or Bh&#x0101;va, i.e. Passives or Neuters </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>cli</em> is added in the Aorist, <em>t&#x0101;si</em> in the 1st Future, <em>sya</em> in the 2nd Future and Conditional, and <em>sip</em> before Le&#x1e6d; </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>lug-vikara&#x1e47;a</em>, 'having <em>luk</em> for its Vik&#x1e6d;Vikara&#x1e47;a' <em>said of roots of cl. 2</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>&#x0101;khy&#x0101;ta-pada-vikara&#x1e47;&#x0101;&#x1e25;</em>, 'words which modify the finite verb', i.e. make it accented) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (<em>&#x012b;</em>), f. a partic. &#x015a;akti Hcat </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; n. change) modification Nir </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a disturbing influence Sarvad</dd>

           <dt>&#x226b; vikram&#x0101;ditya </dt>
           <dd><em>vikram&#x00e2;ditya</em> m. 'valour-sun', N. of a celebrated Hind&#x016b; king (of Ujjayin&#x012b; and supposed founder of the <em>&#x1e43;&#x0101;lava-</em> Vikrama era [cf. <em>sa&#x1e43;vat</em>], which begins 58 B. C. [but subtract 57-56 from an <em>expired</em> year of the Vikrama era to convert it into A&#x1e0c;.] </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; he is said to have driven out the &#x015a;akas and to have reigned over almost the whole of Northern India </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; he is represented as a great patron of literature </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; nine celebrated men are said to have flourished at his court [see <em>nava-ratna</em>], and innumerable legends are related of him all teeming with exaggerations </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; according to some he fell in a battle with his rival &#x015a;&#x0101;li-v&#x0101;hana, king of the south country or Deccan, and the legendary date given for his death is Kali-yuga 3044 <em>which really is the epoch-year of the Vikrama era</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; there are, however, other kings called Vikram&#x00e2;ditya, and the name has been applied to king Bhoja and even to &#x015a;&#x0101;li-v&#x0101;hana) Inscr. Kath&#x0101;s. Vet. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; of a poet Cat. (<em>-ko&#x015b;a</em> m. N. of a dictionary </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>-caritra</em> n. N. of a poem = <em>vikrama-c&#x25cb;</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>-r&#x0101;ja</em> m. N. of a king)</dd>

           <dt>&#x226b; vikr&#x0101;nta </dt>
           <dd><em>v&#x00ed;-kr&#x0101;nta</em> mfn. stepped beyond, taking wide strides &amp;c </dd>

           <dt>vigrah </dt>
           <dd><em>vi-&#x221a;grah</em> P. &#x0100;. <em>-g&#x1e5b;h&#x1e47;&#x0101;ti</em>, <em>&#x25cb;&#x1e47;&#x012b;te</em> (Ved. also <em>-g&#x1e5b;bh&#x1e47;&#x0101;ti</em>, <em>&#x25cb;&#x1e47;&#x012b;te</em>), to stretch out or apart, spread out AV </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to distribute, divide (esp. to draw out fluids at several times) RV. &#x015a;Br. TBr. K&#x0101;ty&#x015a;r </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to hold apart, separate, isolate &#x015a;rS </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (in gram.) to analyse (cf. <em>vi-graha</em>) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to wage war, fight against (acc.) MBh </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to quarrel, contend with (instr. with or without <em>saha</em>, or <em>s&#x00e2;rdham</em>) MBh. K&#x0101;v. &amp;c </dd>

           <dd><em>vi-g&#x1e5b;hya</em> mfn. to be (or being) separated or isolated, independent (in the Pada-p&#x0101;&#x1e6d;ha) APr&#x0101;t</dd>

           <dt>&#x226b; vigraha 2</dt>
           <dd><em>vi-graha</em> m. (for 1. See p. 950. col. 2) keeping apart or asunder, isolation Nir. BhP </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; division, Bh </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; distribution (esp. of fluids, cf. <em>vi-&#x221a;grah</em>) K&#x0101;ty&#x015a;r </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (in gram.) independence (of a word, as opp. to composition) APr&#x0101;t </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; separation, resolution, analysis, resolution of a compound word into its constituent parts, the separation or analysis of any word capable of separation (such words are K&#x1e5b;idantas, Taddhitas, all Sam&#x0101;sas or compound words, Eka&#x015b;eshas, and all derivative verbs like desideratives &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the only words incapable of resolution being the simple verb, the singular of the noun, and a few indeclinables not derived from roots </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; all compounds being called <em>nitya</em> or 'fixed', when their meaning cannot be ascertained through an analysis of their component parts </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; cf. <em>jamad-agni</em>) P&#x0101;&#x1e47;. Sch. &#x015a;a&#x1e43;k. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; discord, quarrel, contest, strife, war with (instr. with or without <em>saha</em>, <em>s&#x00e2;rdham</em> or <em>s&#x0101;kam</em> loc., gen. with <em>upari</em>, or comp.) Mn. MBh. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (one of the 6 Gu&#x1e47;as or measures of policy Mn. vii, 160 [<a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#under">under.</a> <em>gu&#x1e47;a</em>], also applied to the conflict of hostile planets, in this sense also n. S&#x016b;ryas. R </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; acc. with &#x221a;<em>k&#x1e5b;</em>, to make or wage war) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; separate i.e. individual form or shape, form, figure, the body Up. MBh. &amp;c. (also applied to the shape of a rainbow </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; acc. with &#x221a;<em>grah</em>, <em>pari-&#x221a;grah</em>, &#x221a;<em>k&#x1e5b;</em>, <em>up&#x00e2;-&#x221a;d&#x0101;</em>, to assume a form) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; an ornament, decoration MBh. R </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (in S&#x0101;&#x1e43;khya) an element </dd>

           <dd>&#x2022; derision, ridiculousness, mockery, scoff, scorn, vexation, mortification MBh. K&#x0101;v. &amp;c. (acc. with &#x221a;<em>k&#x1e5b;</em>, to mock, deride) </dd>

           <dt>vitardi </dt>
           <dd><em>vi-tardi</em> or <em>&#x25cb;dik&#x0101;</em> f. (said to be fr. &#x221a;<em>t&#x1e5b;d</em>) a raised and covered piece of ground in the centre of a house or temple or in the middle of a court-yard, verandah, balcony &amp;c. R. R&#x0101;jat.            <dd><em>vid</em> cl. 2. P. (Dh&#x0101;tup. xxiv, 56) <em>vetti</em> (<em>vidmahe</em> Br </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>vedati</em>, <em>&#x25cb;te</em> Up. MBh </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>vid&#x00e1;ti</em>, <em>&#x25cb;te</em> AV. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>vindati</em>, <em>&#x25cb;te</em> MBh. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; Impv. <em>vid&#x0101;&#x1e43;-karotu</em> Pa&#x00f1;cat. [<a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#P&#x0101;&#x1e47;">P&#x0101;&#x1e47;.</a> 3-1, 41] </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; 1. sg. impf. <em>avedam</em>, 2. sg. <em>avet</em> or <em>aves</em> [P&#x0101;&#x1e47;. 8-2, 75] RV. &amp;c. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; 3. pl. <em>avidus</em> Br. [<a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#P&#x0101;&#x1e47;">P&#x0101;&#x1e47;.</a> 3-4, 109] </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>avidan</em> MBh. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; pf. <em>v&#x00e9;da</em> [often substituted for pr. <em>vetti</em>, <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#P&#x0101;&#x1e47;">P&#x0101;&#x1e47;.</a> 3-4, 83], 3. pl. <em>vid&#x00fa;s</em> or <em>vidre</em> RV </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>viveda</em> MBh. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>vid&#x0101;&#x1e43;cak&#x0101;&#x0341;ra</em> Br. &amp;c. [<a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#P&#x0101;&#x1e47;">P&#x0101;&#x1e47;.</a> 3-1, 38 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; accord. to Vop. also <em>vid&#x0101;m-babh&#x016b;va</em>] </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; aor. <em>aved&#x012b;t</em> ib </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>vid&#x0101;m-akran</em> TBr </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; fut. <em>vedit&#x0101;&#x0341;</em> &#x015a;Br </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>vett&#x0101;</em> MBh. fut. <em>vedi&#x1e63;yati</em>, <em>&#x25cb;te</em> Br. Up </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>vetsyati</em>, <em>&#x25cb;te</em> MBh. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; inf. <em>v&#x00e9;ditum</em>, <em>&#x25cb;tos</em> Br </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>vettum</em> MBh. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; ind. p. <em>viditv&#x0101;&#x0341;</em> Br. &amp;c.), to know, understand, perceive, learn, become or be acquainted with, be conscious of, have a correct notion of (with acc., in older, language also with gen </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; with inf. = to know how to) RV. &amp;c. &amp;c. (<em>viddhi yath&#x0101;</em>, 'know that' </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>vidy&#x0101;t</em>, 'one should know', 'it should be understood' </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>ya evam veda</em> <em>in Br.</em>, 'who knows thus', who has this knowledge') </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to know or regard or consider as, take for, declare to be, call (esp. in 3. pl. <em>vidus</em>, with two acc. or with acc. and nom. with <em>iti</em>, e. g. <em>ta&#x1e43; sthavira&#x1e43; vidu&#x1e25;</em>, 'they consider or call him aged' </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>r&#x0101;jar&#x1e63;ir iti m&#x0101;&#x1e43; vidu&#x1e25;</em>, 'they consider me a R&#x0101;jarshi') Up. Mn. MBh. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to mind, notice, observe, remember (with gen. or acc.) RV. AV. Br </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to experience, feel (acc. or gen.) RV. &amp;c. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to wish to know, inquire about (acc.) &#x015a;Br. MBh.: Caus. <em>ved&#x00e1;yate</em> (rarely <em>&#x25cb;ti</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; aor. <em>aviividat</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; Pass. <em>vedyate</em>), to make known, announce, report, tell &#x015a;Br. &amp;c. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to teach, explain &#x015a;&#x0101;&#x1e45;kh&#x015a;r. Nir </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to recognize or regard as, take for (two acc.) MBh. K&#x0101;v. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to feel, experience &#x015a;Br. Mn. &amp;c.: Desid. of Caus. in <em>vivedayi&#x1e63;u</em>, q.v.: Desid. <em>vividi&#x1e63;ati</em> or <em>vivitsati</em>, to wish to know or learn, inquire about (acc) &#x015a;Br. &amp;c. &amp;c.: Intens. <em>vevidyate</em>, <em>vevetti</em> Gr. [Cf. Gk. ? for ?, ? for ? = <em>veda</em> ; Lat. <em>videre</em> ; [963, 2] Slav. [v˘ed˘eti] ; Goth. <em>witan</em>, <em>wait</em> ; Germ. <em>wi&#x015b;&#x015b;an</em>, <em>wissen</em> ; Angl. Sax. <em>w&#x00e2;t</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; Eng. wot.]</dd>

           <dt>&#x226b; vitta 1</dt>
           <dd><em>vitta</em> mfn. (for 2. See under &#x221a;3. <em>vid</em>) known, understood ( See comp.) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; celebrated, notorious, famous for (comp.) Da&#x015b;. (cf. P&#x0101;&#x1e47;. 8-2, 58)</dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; vitt&#x0101;rtha </dt>
           <dd><em>vitt&#x00e2;rtha</em> m. 'one who knows the matter', an expert L</dd>

           <dt>&#x226b; vittaka 1</dt>
           <dd><em>vittaka</em> mfn. very famous or renowned Da&#x015b;. 1. <font color="#FF0000" font size=-2><a name="p963-3"></a>[Page 963, Column 3]</font>
</dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; vitti </dt>
           <dd><em>vitti</em> f. consciousness Sarvad </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; understanding, intelligence, Sa&#x1e43;hitUp</dd>

           <dt>&#x226b; vid 2</dt>
           <dd><em>v&#x00ed;d</em> mfn. knowing, understanding, a knower (mostly ifc </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; superl. <em>vit-tama</em>) Ka&#x1e6d;hUp. Mn. MBh. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; m. the planet Mercury VarB&#x1e5b;S. (cf. 2. <em>j&#x00f1;a</em>) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; f. knowledge understanding RV. KaushUp </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (pl.) Bh&#x0101;m</dd>

           <dt>&#x226b; vida </dt>
           <dd><em>vida</em> mfn. = prec. (cf. <em>ko-</em>, <em>tray&#x012b;-</em>, <em>dvi-v&#x25cb;</em>) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; m. knowledge, discovery (cf. <em>dur-v&#x25cb;</em>) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; m. N. of a man (cf. <em>bida</em>)</dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; vidaga&#x1e47;a </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x25cb;ga&#x1e47;&#x00e1;</em> (?) AV. xix, 22, 18</dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; vidabh&#x1e5b;t </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x25cb;bh&#x1e5b;t</em> m. N. of a man, g. <em>garg&#x00e2;di</em> (cf. <em>vaidabh&#x1e5b;ta</em>, <em>&#x25cb;tya</em>)</dd>

           <dt>&#x226b; vidatra </dt>
           <dd><em>vidatra</em> See <em>dur-</em> and <em>su-vid&#x00e1;tra</em></dd>

           <dt>&#x226b; vidatriya </dt>
           <dd><em>vidatriya</em> See <em>su-vidatr&#x00ed;ya</em></dd>

           <dt>&#x226b; vidatha </dt>
           <dd><em>vid&#x00e1;tha</em> n. knowledge, wisdom </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (esp.) 'knowledge given to others', i.e. instruction, direction, order, arrangement, disposition, rule, command (also pl.) RV. AV. VS. (<em>vidatham &#x0101;-&#x221a;vad</em>, to impart knowledge, give instruction, rule, govern) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a meeting, assembly (either for deliberating or for the observance of festive or religious rites, i.e.) council, community, association, congregation ib. (also applied to partic. associations or communities of gods, which in RV. viii, 39, 1 &amp;c. are opposed to those of men </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; in RV. ii, 27, 8 ; vi, 51, 2 &amp;c. three associations of gods are mentioned) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a host, army, body of warriors (esp. applied to the Maruts) RV </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; war, fight ib </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a sage, scholar L </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a saint, devotee, ascetic (= <em>yogin</em>) L </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; = <em>k&#x1e5b;tin</em> L </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; N. of a man S&#x0101;y. on RV. v, 33, 9</dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; vidathin </dt>
           <dd><em>vid&#x00e1;&#x1e0d;thin</em> m. N. of a man P&#x0101;&#x1e47;. 6-4, 165 (cf. <em>vaidathina</em>)</dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; vidathya </dt>
           <dd><em>vid&#x00e1;&#x1e0d;thy&#x00e1;</em> mfn. fit for an assembly or council or any religious observance, festive, solemn RV</dd>

           <dd>&#x2022; promised, agreed L </dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; vidupa </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x25cb;pa</em> m. N. of a king VP</dd>

           <dt>&#x226b; vidura </dt>
           <dd><em>vidura</em> mfn. knowing, wise, intelligent, skilled in (comp.) Uttamac </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; m. a learned or clever man W </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; an intriguer ib </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; N. of the younger brother of Dh&#x1e5b;ita-r&#x0101;sh&#x1e6d;ra and P&#x0101;&#x1e47;&#x1e0d;u (they were all three sons of Vy&#x0101;sa, but only the latter two by the two widows of Vicitra-viirya </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; when Vy&#x0101;sa wanted a third son, the elder widow sent him one of her slave-girls, dressed in her own clothes, and this girl became the mother of Vidura, who is sometimes called Kshatt&#x1e5b;i, as if he were the son of a Kshatriya man and &#x015a;&#x016b;dra woman Vidura is described as <em>sarva-buddhimat&#x0101;&#x1e43; vara&#x1e25;</em> and is one of the wisest characters in the Mah&#x0101;-bh&#x0101;rata, always ready with good advice both for his nephews, the P&#x0101;&#x1e47;&#x1e0d;avas, and for his brother Dh&#x1e5b;ita-r&#x0101;sh&#x1e6d;ra) MBh. Hariv. Pur. (cf. IW. 376 ; 385 &amp;c.)</dd>

           <dt>&#x226b; vidya 1</dt>
           <dd><em>vidya</em> (for 2. See p. 965, col. 1) = <em>vidy&#x0101;</em> (ifc </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; See <em>a-v&#x25cb;</em> <em>&#x25cb;k&#x1e5b;ta-vidya</em>, <em>sam&#x0101;na-vidya-t&#x0101;</em>)</dd>

           <dt>&#x226b; vidy&#x0101; </dt>
           <dd><em>vidy&#x0101;&#x0341;</em> f. knowledge (cf. <em>k&#x0101;la-j&#x0101;ta-v&#x25cb;</em>), science, learning, scholarship, philosophy RV. &amp;c. &amp;c. (according to some there are four Vidy&#x0101;s or sciences, 1. <em>tray&#x012b;</em>, the triple Veda </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; 2. <em>&#x0101;nviik&#x1e63;ik&#x012b;</em>, logic and metaphysics </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; 3. <em>da&#x1e47;&#x1e0d;a-n&#x012b;ti</em>, the science of government </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; 4. <em>v&#x0101;rtt&#x0101;</em>, practical arts, such as agriculture, commerce, medicine &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; and Manu vii, 43 adds a fifth, viz. <em>&#x0101;tma-vidy&#x0101;</em>, knowledge of soul or of spiritual truth </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; according to others, Vidy&#x0101; has fourteen divisions, viz. the four Vedas, the six Ved&#x0101;&#x1e45;gas, the Pur&#x0101;&#x1e47;as, the M&#x012b;m&#x0101;&#x1e43;s&#x0101;. Ny&#x0101;ya, and Dharma or law <font color="#FF0000" font size=-2><a name="p964-1"></a>[Page 964, Column 1]</font> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; or with the four Upa-vedas, eighteen divisions </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; others reckon 33 and even 64 sciences [= <em>kal&#x0101;s</em> or arts] </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; Knowledge is also personified and identified with Durg&#x0101; </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; she is even said to have composed prayers and magical formulas) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; any knowledge whether true or false (with P&#x0101;&#x015b;upatas) Sarvad </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a spell, incantation MBh. Ragh. Kath&#x0101;s </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; magical skill MW </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a kind of magical pill (which placed in the mouth is supposed to give the power of ascending to heaven) W </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; Premna Spinosa L </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a mystical N. of the letter <em>i</em> Up </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a small bell L. (cf. <em>vidy&#x0101;ma&#x1e47;i</em>). 1</dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; vidy&#x0101;kara </dt>

           <dt>vid 3</dt>
           <dd><em>vid</em> (originally identical with &#x221a;1. <em>vid</em>), cl. 6. P. &#x0100;. (Dh&#x0101;tup. xxviii, 138) <em>vind&#x00e1;ti</em>, <em>&#x25cb;te</em> (Ved. also <em>vitt&#x00e9;</em>, <em>vid&#x00e9;</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; p. <em>vid&#x0101;n&#x00e1;</em> or <em>vid&#x0101;na</em> <em>q.v.</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; ep. 3. pl. <em>vindate</em> Pot. <em>vindy&#x0101;t</em>, often = <em>vidy&#x0101;t</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; pf. <em>viv&#x00e9;da</em> [3. pl. <em>vividus</em> Subj. <em>vividat</em>], <em>vividv&#x00e1;s</em>, 3. pl. <em>vividre</em>, <em>vidr&#x00e9;</em> RV. &amp;c. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; p. <em>vividv&#x00e1;s</em> RV </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>vividivas</em> P&#x0101;&#x1e47;. 7-2, 68 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; aor. <em>&#x00e1;vidat</em>, <em>&#x25cb;data</em> ib. [Ved. Subj. <em>vid&#x0101;&#x0341;si</em>, <em>&#x25cb;d&#x0101;&#x0341;t</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; Pot. <em>vid&#x00e9;t</em>, <em>deta</em> VS. AV. Br </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; 3. sg. <em>vide&#x1e63;&#x1e6d;a</em> AV. ii, 36, 3] </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; &#x0100;. 1. sg. <em>avitsi</em> RV. Br </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; fut. <em>vett&#x0101;</em>, <em>vedi&#x1e63;yati</em> Gr </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>vetsyati</em>, <em>&#x25cb;te</em> Br. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; inf. <em>vid&#x00e9;</em> RV </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>vettum</em> MBh. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>v&#x00e9;ttave</em> AV </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>&#x25cb;ttavai</em> [?] and <em>&#x25cb;tos</em> Br </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; ind. p. <em>vittv&#x0101;&#x0341;</em> AV. Br </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>-vidya</em> Br. &amp;c.), to find, discover, meet or fall in with, obtain, get, acquire, partake of, possess RV. &amp;c. &amp;c. (with <em>di&#x015b;as</em>, to find out the quarters of she sky MBh.) <font color="#FF0000" font size=-2><a name="p965-1"></a>[Page 965, Column 1]</font> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to get or procure for (dat.) RV. ChUp </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to seek out, look for, attend to RV. &amp;c. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to feel, experience C&#x0101;&#x1e47; </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to consider as, take for (two acc.) K&#x0101;v </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to come upon, befall, seize, visit RV. AV. Br </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to contrive, accomplish, perform, effect, produce RV. &#x015a;Br </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (&#x0100;., m. c. also P.) to take to wife, marry (with or scil. <em>bh&#x0101;ry&#x0101;m</em>) RV. Mn. MBh. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to find (a husband), marry (said of a woman) AV. Mn. MBh </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to obtain (a son, with or scil. <em>sutam</em>) BhP.: Pass. or &#x0100;. <em>vidy&#x00e1;te</em> (ep. also <em>&#x25cb;ti</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; p. <em>vidyam&#x0101;na</em> <em>q.v.</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; aor. <em>avedi</em>), to be found, exist, be RV. &amp;c. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (esp. in later language) <em>vidyate</em>, 'there is, there exists', often with <em>na</em>, 'there is not' </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; with <em>bhoktum</em>, 'there is something to eat' </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; followed by a fut., 'is it possible that?' P&#x0101;&#x1e47;. 3-3, 146 Sch </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>yath&#x0101;-vid&#x00e9;</em>, 'as it happens', i.e. 'as usual', 'as well as possible' RV. i, 127, 4 &amp;c.: Caus. <em>vedayati</em>, to cause to find &amp;c. MBh.: Desid. <em>vividi&#x1e63;ati</em> or <em>vivitsati</em>, <em>&#x25cb;te</em> Gr. (cf. <em>vivitsita</em>): Intens. <em>vevidyate</em>, <em>vevetti</em> ib. (for p. <em>v&#x00e9;vidat</em> and <em>&#x25cb;d&#x0101;na</em> See <em>vi-</em> and <em>sa&#x1e43;&#x221a;vid</em>)</dd>

           <dt>&#x226b; vitta 2</dt>
           <dd><em>vitt&#x00e1;</em> mfn. (for 1. See p. 963) found, acquired, gained, obtained, possessed AV. Br </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; caught or seized by (instr. or comp.) Br. Kau&#x015b; </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (<em>&#x0101;</em>), f. taken, married (as a woman) &#x015a;Br </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; n. anything found, a find AitBr </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (in later language also pl.) acquisition, wealth, property, goods, substance, money, power RV. &amp;c. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the second astrological mansion VarYogay</dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; vittak&#x0101;ma </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x25cb;k&#x0101;ma</em> mfn. desirous of wealth, covetous, avaricious MBh </dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; vittagopt&#x1e5b; </dt>

           <dt>&#x22d9; vittada </dt>

           <dt>&#x22d9; vittadugdha </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x25cb;dugdha</em> n. 'milk-wealth', wealth compared to milk Hit</dd>

           <dt>&#x226b; vidagdha </dt>
           <dd><em>v&#x00ed;-dagdha</em> mfn. burnt up, consumed &#x015a;Br. Kau&#x015b;. <font color="#FF0000" font size=-2><a name="p965-3"></a>[Page 965, Column 3]</font> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; inflamed Su&#x015b;r </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; cooked by internal heat as by the fire of digestion, digested ib </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; decomposed, corrupted, spoiled, turned sour ib </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; mature (as a tumour) Bhpr </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; tawny or reddish brown (like impure blood) L </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; clever, shrewd, knowing, sharp, crafty, sly, artful, intriguing MBh. K&#x0101;v. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; m. tawny (the colour) L </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a clever man, scholar, Pa&#x1e47;&#x1e0d;it W </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a libertine, intriguer ib </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; N. of a teacher of the V&#x0101;jasaneyins &#x015a;Br </dd>

           <dd>&#x2022; <em>-cu&#x1e0d;&#x0101;ma&#x1e47;i</em> m. N. of an enchanted parrot Kath&#x0101;s. Vet </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>-t&#x0101;</em> f. <em>-tva</em> n. cleverness, sharpness, skill in (loc.) K&#x0101;v </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>-to&#x1e63;i&#x1e47;&#x012b;</em> f. N. of an astron. wk </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>-pariv&#x1e5b;ddhat&#x0101;</em> f. the turning acid and swelling (of food in the stomach) Su&#x015b;r </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>-pari&#x1e63;ad</em> f. an assembly or company of clever people Bhart&#x1e5b; </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>-bodha</em> m. N. of a grammar (by R&#x0101;ma-candra Mi&#x015b;ra) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>-m&#x0101;dhava</em> n. N. of a N&#x0101;&#x1e6d;aka or drama (by R&#x016b;pa Go-sv&#x0101;min, in 7 acts, written A&#x1e0c;. 1549 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; it is a dramatic version of the G&#x012b;ta-govinda on the loves of K&#x1e5b;ish&#x1e47;a and R&#x0101;dh&#x0101;) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>-mukha-ma&#x1e47;&#x1e0d;ana</em> n. N. of wk. on enigmas (by the Buddhist Dharmad&#x0101;sa) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>-vacana</em> mfn. clever or skilful in speech Pa&#x00f1;cat </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>-vaidya</em> m. N. of a medical writer </dd>

           <dt>vidradha </dt>

           <dd>&#x2022; Durga = <em>viku&#x1e63;it&#x00e2;dho-bh&#x0101;ga</em> S&#x0101;y. = <em>vi-d&#x1e5b;&#x1e0d;ha</em> </dd>

           <dd>&#x2022; to be accounted, pass for (nom.) ib. iii, 118: Caus. <em>-dh&#x0101;payati</em>, to cause to put, cause to be laid R </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; cause to put in order or arrange or fix MW.: Desid. <em>-dhitsati</em>, <em>&#x25cb;te</em>, to wish to distribute or bestow BhP </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to wish to decide or determine or fix or establish &#x015a;a&#x1e43;k </dd>

           <dt>&#x226b; vidha </dt>
           <dd><em>vidha</em> (for 1. See col. 2), m. n. of <em>vidh&#x0101;</em> (ifc.) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; m. measure, form, kind L </dd>

           <dt>&#x226b; vidh&#x0101; </dt>
           <dd><em>vi-dh&#x0101;&#x0341;</em> f. division, part, portion &#x015a;Br. &#x015a;ulbas. (often ifc. = 'fold' </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; cf. <em>eka-</em>, <em>bahu-vidha</em> &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; also adv. in <em>tri-</em> and <em>dvi-vidh&#x0101;</em>, q.v.) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; form, manner, kind, sort TS. &amp;c. &amp;c. (<em>yay&#x0101; kay&#x0101;-cid vidhay&#x0101;</em>, in whatsoever way, anyhow </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; often ifc </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; cf. <em>asmad-</em> <em>eva&#x1e43;-</em>, <em>n&#x0101;n&#x0101;-vidha</em> &amp;c.) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; fodder Pat </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; increase (= <em>&#x1e5b;ddhi</em>) L </dd>

           <dt>&#x226b; vidhi 2</dt>
           <dd><em>vidhi</em> m. (for 1. See p. 967, col. 2) a rule, formula, injunction, ordinance, statute, precept, law, direction (esp. for the performance of a rite as given in the Br&#x0101;hma&#x1e47;a portion of the Veda, which accord. to S&#x0101;y. consists of two parts, 1.            <dd>&#x2022; 2. Artha-v&#x0101;da, 'explanatory statements' as to the origin of rites and use of the Mantras, mixed up with legends and illustrations) G&#x1e5b;&#x015a;rS. Mn. MBh. &amp;c. (cf. IW. 24) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a grammatical rule or precept P&#x0101;&#x1e47;. 1-1, 57 ; 72 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; any prescribed act or rite or ceremony Mn. K&#x0101;lid. Pa&#x00f1;cat </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; use, employment, application Car </dd>

           <dd>&#x2022; any act or action, performance, accomplishment, contrivance, work, business (ifc. often pleonastically, e.g. <em>mathana-vidhi</em>, the <em>act of</em> disturbing) Y&#x0101;j&#x00f1;. &#x015a;ak. &amp;c </dd>

           <dd><em>v&#x00ed;n&#x0101;</em> or <em>vin&#x0101;&#x0341;</em> ind. (prob. a kind of instr. of 3. <em>vi</em>) without, except, short or exclusive of (preceded or followed by an acc., instr., rarely abl </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#P&#x0101;&#x1e47;">P&#x0101;&#x1e47;.</a> 2-3, 32 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; exceptionally ifc., e, g. <em>&#x015b;uci-vin&#x0101;</em>, without honesty, <em>satya-v&#x25cb;</em>, without faith Subh.) AV. xx, 136, 13 (not in manuscript) Mn. MBh. &amp;c. (sometimes <em>vin&#x0101;</em> is used pleonastically, e.g. <em>natad asti vin&#x0101; deva yat te virahita&#x1e43; hare</em>, 'there is nothing, O god Hari, that is without thee' Hariv. 14966)</dd>

           <dd>&#x2022; standing alone, solitary. R</dd>

           <dt>vindhasa </dt>
           <dd><em>vindhasa</em> (?), m. the moon L</dd>

           <dt>vindhya </dt>
           <dd><em>vindhya</em> m. (of doubtful derivation) N. of a low range of hills connecting the Northern extremities of the Western and Eastern Ghauts, and separating Hind&#x016b;st&#x0101;n proper from the Dekhan (the Vindhya range is reckoned among the seven principal ranges of Bh&#x0101;rata-varsha [see <em>kulagiri</em>, p. 294, col. 3], and according to Manu ii, 21, forms the Southern limit of Madhya-de&#x015b;a or the middle region </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; according to a legend related in MBh. iii, 8782 &amp;c., the personified Vindhya, jealous of Him&#x00e2;laya, demanded that the sun should revolve round him in the same way as about Meru, which the sun declining to do, the Vindhya then began to elevate himself that he might bar the progress of both sun and moon </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the gods alarmed, asked the aid of the saint Agastya, who approached the Vindhya and requested that by bending down he would afford him an easy passage to the South country, begging at the same time that he would retain a low position till his return </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; this he promised to do, but Agastya never returned, and the Vindhya range consequently never attained the elevation of the Him&#x00e2;laya) Mn. MBh. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; N. of a prince HPari&#x015b; </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a hunter L </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (<em>&#x0101;</em>), f. Averrhoa Acida L </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; small cardamoms L</dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; vindhyakandara </dt>

           <dt>vip 1</dt>
           <dd><em>vip</em> (or <em>vep</em>), cl. 1. &#x0100;. (Dh&#x0101;tup. x, 6) <em>vepate</em> (ep. also <em>&#x25cb;ti</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; p. <em>vip&#x0101;n&#x00e1;</em> RV </dd>

           <dd>&#x2022; inf. <em>vepitum</em> ib.), to tremble, shake, shiver, vibrate, quiver, be stirred RV. &amp;c. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to start back through fear Pa&#x00f1;car.            <dd>&#x2022; ripening, maturing (esp. of the fruit of actions), effect, result, consequence (of actions in the present or former births pursuing those who commit them through subsequent existences) Y&#x0101;j&#x00f1;. MBh. &amp;c </dd>

           <dd>&#x2022; (ibc.) subsequently, afterwards ( See comp.) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>-ka&#x1e6d;uka</em> mfn. sharp or bitter in its consequences Kath&#x0101;s </dd>

           <dd>&#x2022; <em>-t&#x012b;vra</em> mfn. sharp or terrible in consequence of (comp.) BhP </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>-d&#x0101;ru&#x1e47;a</em> mfn. terrible or dangerous in results Prab </dd>

           <dt>vipula </dt>

           <dd>&#x2022; <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#under">under.</a> &#x221a;<em>pul</em>) large, extensive, wide, great, thick, long (also of time), abundant, numerous, important, loud (as a noise), noble (as a race) P&#x0101;rG&#x1e5b;. MBh. &amp;c </dd>

           <dd>&#x2022; of a pupil of Deva-&#x015b;arman (who guarded the virtue of Ruci, his preceptor's wife, when tempted by Indra during her husband's absence) MBh </dd>

           <dd>&#x2022; a form of the &#x0100;ry&#x0101; metre (in which the caesura is irregular </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; divided into 3 species, &#x0100;di-, Anlya-, and Ubhaya-vipul&#x0101;) Col </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (in music) a kind of measure Sa&#x1e43;g&#x012b;t </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; n. a sort of building Gal </dd>

           <dt>vibhaj </dt>

           <dd>&#x2022; both R&#x0101;va&#x1e47;a and Vibhisha&#x1e47;a are said to have propitiated Brahm&#x0101; by their penances, so that the god granted them both boons, and the boon chosen by Vibhisha&#x1e47;a was that he should never, even in the greatest calamity, stoop to any mean action </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; hence he is represented in the R&#x0101;m&#x0101;ya&#x1e47;a as endeavouring to counteract the malice of his brother R&#x0101;va&#x1e47;a, in consequence of which he was so ill-treated by him that, leaving La&#x1e45;k&#x0101;, he joined R&#x0101;ma, by whom, after the death of R&#x0101;va&#x1e47;a, V&#x1e6d;Vibhisha&#x1e47;a was placed on the throne of La&#x1e45;k&#x0101;) MBh.            <dd>&#x2022; m. n. a car or chariot of the gods, any mythical self-moving aerial car (sometimes serving as a seat or throne, sometimes self-moving and carrying its occupant through the air </dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; vim&#x0101;naka </dt>

           <dt>&#x226b; viyoga </dt>

           <dt>&#x22d9; viramita </dt>
           <dd><em>vi-&#x1e0d;ramita</em> mfn. (fr. Caus.) made to cease, stopped BhP</dd>

           <dt>&#x226b; vir&#x0101;ma </dt>
           <dd><em>vi-r&#x0101;ma</em> m. cessation, termination, end &#x015a;&#x0101;&#x1e45;khG&#x1e5b;. Mn. &amp;c. (acc. with &#x221a;<em>y&#x0101;</em> or <em>pra-&#x221a;y&#x0101;</em>, to come to an end, rest) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; end of a word or sentence, stop, pause (ifc. = ending with), APr&#x0101;t. P&#x0101;&#x1e47;. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; end of or caesura with in a P&#x0101;da &#x015a;rutab </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (in gram.), the stop', N. of a small oblique stroke placed under a consonant to denote that it is quiescent, i.e. that it has no vowel inherent or otherwise pronounced after it (this mark is sometimes used in the middle of conjunctions of consonants </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; but its proper use, according to native grammarians, is only as a stop at the end of a sentence ending in a consonant) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; desistence, abstention K&#x0101;&#x015b;. Vop </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; exhaustion, languor Car </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; N. of Vish&#x1e47;u MBh </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; of &#x015a;iva &#x015a;ivag </dd>

           <dt>vir&#x0101;j </dt>
           <dd><em>vi-&#x221a;r&#x0101;j</em> P.&#x0100;. <em>-r&#x0101;jati</em>, <em>&#x25cb;te</em>, to reign, rule, govern, master (gen. or acc.), excel (abl.) RV. AV. Br </dd>

           <dt>&#x226b; vir&#x0101;j 2</dt>
           <dd><em>vi-r&#x0101;&#x0341;j</em> mfn. (for 1. See p. 949, col. 3) ruling far and wide, sovereign, excellent, splendid RV </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; mfn. a ruler, chief. king or queen (applied to Agni, Sarasvat&#x012b;, the Sun &amp;c.) ib. AV. VS. Br. MBh </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; f. excellence, pre-eminence, high rank, dignity, majesty TS. Br. &#x015a;rS </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; m. or f. the first progeny of Brahm&#x0101; (according to Mn. i, 32 &amp;c., Brahm&#x0101; having divided his own substance into male and female, produced from the female the male power Vir&#x0101;j, who then produced the first Manu or Manu Sv&#x0101;yambhuva, who then created the ten Praj&#x0101;-patis </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the BhP. states that the male half of Brahm&#x0101; was Manu, and the other half &#x015a;ata-r&#x016b;p&#x0101;, and does not allude to the intervention of Vir&#x0101;j </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; other Pur&#x0101;&#x1e47;as describe the union of &#x015a;ata-r&#x016b;p&#x0101; with V&#x1e6d;Vir&#x0101;j or Purusha in the first instance, and with Manu in the second </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; Vir&#x0101;j as a sort of secondary creator, is sometimes identified with Praj&#x0101;-pati, Brahm&#x0101;, Agni, Purusha, and later with Vish&#x1e47;u or K&#x1e5b;ish&#x1e47;a, while in RV. x, 90, he is represented as born from Purusha, and Purusha from him </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; in the AV. viii, 10, 24 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; xi, 8, 30, Vir&#x0101;j is spoken of as a female, and regarded as a cow </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; being elsewhere, however, identified with Pr&#x00e2;&#x1e47;a) IW. 22 &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (in Ved&#x0101;nta) N. of the Supreme Intellect located in a supposed aggregate of gross bodies (= <em>vai&#x015b;v&#x0101;nara</em>, q. v.), Vedantas </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; m. a warrior (= <em>k&#x1e63;atriya</em>) MBh. BhP </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the body MW </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a partic. Ek&#x00e2;ha Pa&#x00f1;cavBr. Vait </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; N. of a son of Priya-vrata and K&#x0101;my&#x0101; Hariv </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; of a son of Nara VP </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; cf Buddha L. <font color="#FF0000" font size=-2><a name="p983-1"></a>[Page 983, Column 1]</font> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; of a son of R&#x0101;dh&#x0101; MW </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; of a district ib </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; f. a particular Vedic metre consisting of four P&#x0101;das of ten syllables each (and therefore also a symbolical N. of the number 'ten' </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; in RV. x, 130, 5 this metre is represented as attaching itself to Mitra and Varu&#x1e47;a, and in AitBr. i, 4 Vir&#x0101;j is mystically regarded as 'food', and invocations are directed to be made in this metre when food is the especial object of prayer </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; in prosody Vir&#x0101;j is applied to any metre defective by two syllables RPr&#x0101;t.) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; pl. N. of partic. bricks (40 in number) VS. &#x015a;Br</dd>

           <dt>vi&#x015b;loka </dt>
           <dd><em>vi-&#x015b;loka</em> See p. 953, col. 1</dd>

           <dt>vi&#x015b;va </dt>
           <dd><em>v&#x00ed;&#x015b;va</em> mf(<em>&#x0101;</em>)n. (prob. fr. &#x221a;1. <em>vi&#x015b;</em>, to pervade, <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#U&#x1e47;">U&#x1e47;.</a> i, 151 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; declined as a pron. like <em>sarva</em>, by which it is superseded in the Br&#x0101;hma&#x1e47;as and later language) all, every, every one </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; whole, entire, universal RV. &amp;c. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; all-pervading or all-containing, omnipresent (applied to Vish&#x1e47;u-K&#x1e5b;ish&#x1e47;a, the soul, intellect &amp;c.) Up. MBh. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; m. (in phil.) the intellectual faculty or (accord. to some) the faculty which perceives individuality or the individual underlying the gross body (<em>sth&#x016b;la-&#x015b;ar&#x012b;ra-vya&#x1e63;ty-upahita</em>) Ved&#x00e2;ntas </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; N. of a class of gods, <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#below">below.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; N. of the number 'thirteen' Gol </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; of a class of deceased ancestors M&#x0101;rkP </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; of a king MBh </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; of a well-known dictionary = <em>vi&#x015b;va-prak&#x0101;&#x015b;a</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; pl. (<em>v&#x00ed;&#x015b;ve</em>, with or scil. <em>dev&#x0101;&#x0341;s</em>, cf. <em>vi&#x015b;ve-deva</em>, p. 995) 'all the gods collectively' or the, All-gods' (a partic. class of gods, forming one of the 9 Ga&#x1e47;as enumerated under <em>ga&#x1e47;adevat&#x0101;</em>, q.v </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; accord. to the Vishnu and other Pur&#x0101;&#x1e47;as they were sons of Vi&#x015b;v&#x0101;, daughter of Daksha, and their names are as follow, 1. Vasu, 2. Satya, 3. Kratu, 4. Daksha, 5. K&#x0101;la, 6. K&#x0101;ma, 7. Dh&#x1e5b;iti, 8. Kuru, 9. Pur&#x016b;-ravas, 10. M&#x0101;dravas [?] </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; two others are added by some, viz. 11. Rocaka or Locana, 12. Dhvani [or Dh&#x016b;ri </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; or this may make 13]: they are particularly worshipped at &#x015a;r&#x0101;ddhas and at the Vai&#x015b;vadeva ceremony <em>&#x1e5b;&#x1e6d;&#x1e3b;. 416</em> <font color="#FF0000" font size=-2><a name="p992-3"></a>[Page 992, Column 3]</font> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; moreover, accord. to Manu [iii, 90, 121], offerings should be made to them daily - these privileges having been bestowed on them by Brahm&#x0101; and the Pit&#x1e5b;is, as a reward for severe austerities they had performed on the Him&#x00e2;laya: sometimes it is difficult to decide whether the expression <em>vi&#x015b;ve dev&#x0101;&#x1e25;</em> refers to all the gods or to the particular troop of deities described above) RV. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (<em>&#x0101;</em>), f. the earth L. (loc. pl. 'in all places, everywhere' RV. viii, 106, 2) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; dry ginger L </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; Piper Longum L </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; Asparagus Racemosus L </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; = <em>ati-vi&#x1e63;&#x0101;</em>, or <em>vi&#x1e63;&#x0101;</em> L </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; N. of one of the tongues of Agni, M&#x0101;rkP </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a partic. weight L </dd>

           <dd>&#x2022; <em>-pur&#x0101;&#x1e47;a</em> n. <em>&#x25cb;&#x1e47;a-sa&#x1e43;graha</em> m. <em>-prak&#x0101;&#x015b;a</em> m. <em>-m&#x0101;h&#x0101;tmya</em>, n. N. of wks </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>-&#x015b;&#x0101;strin</em> m. N. of an author Cat </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>-siddh&#x00e2;nta</em> m. N. of wk </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>-sut&#x0101;</em> f. = <em>vi&#x015b;va-karma-j&#x0101;</em> L </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>&#x25cb;m&#x00ea;&#x015b;a</em> or <em>&#x25cb;m&#x00ea;&#x015b;vara-li&#x1e45;ga</em> n. N. of a Li&#x1e45;ga Cat</dd>

           <dt>&#x226b; vi&#x015b;vakarman </dt>
           <dd><em>vi&#x015b;va-karman</em> n. (only ibc.) every action MaitrUp. V&#x0101;s </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (<em>vi&#x015b;v&#x00e1;-</em>), mfn. accomplishing or creating everything RV. AV. Br. MBh. Hariv </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; m. 'all-doer, all-creator, all-maker', N. of the divine creative architect or artist (said to be son of Brahm&#x0101;, and in the later mythology sometimes identified with Tvash&#x1e6d;&#x1e5b;i, q.v., he is said to have revealed the Sth&#x0101;patyaveda, q.v., or fourth Upa-veda, and to preside over all manual labours as well as the sixty-four mechanical arts <em>whence he is worshipped by K&#x0101;rus or artisans</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; in the Vedic mythology, however, the office of Indian Vulcan is assigned to Tvash&#x1e6d;&#x1e5b;i as a distinct deity, Vi&#x015b;va-karman being rather identified with Praj&#x0101;-pati <em>Brahm&#x0101;</em> himself as the creator of all things and architect of the universe </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; in the hymns RV. x, 81 ; 82 he is represented as the universal Father and Generator, the one all-seeing God, who has on every side eyes, faces, arms, and feet </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; in Nir. x, 26 and elsewhere in the Brahma&#x1e47;as he is called a son of Bhuvana, and Vi&#x015b;va-karman Bhauvana is described as the author of the two hymns mentioned above </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; in the MBh. and Hariv. he is a son of the Vasu Prabh&#x0101;sa and Yoga-siddh&#x0101; </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; in the Pur&#x0101;&#x1e47;as a son of V&#x0101;stu, and the father of Barhishmat&#x012b; and Sa&#x1e43;j&#x00f1;&#x0101; </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; accord. to other authorities he is the husband of Gh&#x1e5b;it&#x0101;c&#x012b; </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; moreover, a doubtful legend is told of his having offered up all beings, including himself. in sacrifice </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the R&#x0101;m&#x00e2;ya&#x1e47;a represents him as having built the city of La&#x1e45;k&#x0101; for the R&#x0101;kshasas, and as having generated the ape Nala, who made R&#x0101;ma's bridge from the continent to the island </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the name Vi&#x015b;va-karman, meaning, doing all acts', appears to be sometimes applicable as an epithet to any great divinity) RV. &amp;c. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; N. of S&#x016b;rya or the Sun V&#x0101;s. M&#x0101;rkP </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; of one of the seven principal rays of the sun (supposed to supply heat to the planet Mercury) VP </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; of the wind VS. xv, 16 (Mah&#x012b;dh.) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; N. of a Muni L </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (also with <em>&#x015b;&#x0101;strin</em>) N. of various authors Cat</dd>

           <dt>&#x226b; vi&#x015b;vakarm&#x012b;ya </dt>
           <dd><em>vi&#x015b;vakarm&#x012b;ya</em> n. any work of Vi&#x015b;va-karman Cat </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>-&#x015b;ilpa</em> n. N. of work. <font color="#FF0000" font size=-2><a name="p994-3"></a>[Page 994, Column 3]</font>

           <dd><em>vi&#x015b;v&#x0101;ci</em> f. (fr. <em>vi&#x015b;va</em> + 2. <em>a&#x00f1;c</em>) universal RV </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; f. paralysis of the arms and the back Su&#x015b;r </dd>

           <dt>&#x226b; vi&#x015b;v&#x0101;mitra </dt>
           <dd><em>vi&#x015b;v&#x0101;&#x0341;-mitra</em> m. (prob.) 'friend of all', N. of a celebrated &#x1e5a;ishi or Sage (having the patr. G&#x0101;thina, G&#x0101;dheya, and J&#x0101;hnava </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; he was at first a functionary, together with Vasish&#x1e6d;ha, of Su-d&#x0101;s, king of the T&#x1e5b;itsus </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; seeing Vasish&#x1e6d;ha preferred by the king, he went over to the Bharatas, but could not prevent their being defeated by Su-d&#x0101;s, although he caused the waters of the rivers Vip&#x0101;&#x015b; and &#x015a;utudri to retire and so give the Bharatas free passage RV. iii, 33 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; he was born as a Kshatriya, deriving his lineage from an ancestor of Ku&#x015b;ika, named Pur&#x016b;-ravas, of the lunar race of kings, and himself sovereign of Kany&#x0101;-kubja or Kanoj </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; his fame rests chiefly on his contests with the great Br&#x0101;hman Vasish&#x1e6d;ha, and his success in elevating himself. though a Kshatriya, to the rank of a Br&#x0101;hman, See Manu vii, 42: the R&#x0101;maya&#x1e47;a, which makes him a companion and counsellor of the young R&#x0101;ma-candra, records [i, 51-65] how Vi&#x015b;v&#x0101;mitra, on his accession to the throne, visited Vasish&#x1e6d;ha's hermitage, and seeing there the cow of plenty [probably typical of <em>go</em>, the earth'], offered him untold treasures in exchange for it, but being refused, prepared to take it by force </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a long contest ensued between the king and the saint <em>symbolical of the struggles between the Kshatriya and Br&#x0101;hmanical classes</em>, which ended in the defeat of Vi&#x015b;v&#x0101;mitra, whose vexation was such that, in order to become a Br&#x0101;hman and thus conquer his rival, he devoted himself to intense austerities [during which he was seduced by the nymph Menak&#x0101; and had by her a daughter, &#x015a;akuntal&#x0101;], gradually increasing the rigour of his mortification through thousands of years, till he successively earned the titles of R&#x0101;jarshi, &#x1e5a;ishi, Maharshi, and finally Brahmarshi <font color="#FF0000" font size=-2><a name="p995-1"></a>[Page 995, Column 1]</font> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; he is supposed to be the author of nearly the whole of RV. iii, and of ix, 67, 1315 ; x, 137, 5 ; 167 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; moreover, a law-book, a Dhanurveda, and a medical wk. are attributed to him) RV. &amp;c. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a partic. Catur-aha (= <em>vi&#x015b;v&#x0101;mitrasya sa&#x1e43;jaya&#x1e25;</em>) Pa&#x00f1;cavBr. K&#x0101;ty&#x015a;r </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a partic. Anuv&#x0101;ka (= <em>vi&#x015b;v&#x0101;mitrasy&#x00e2;nuv&#x0101;ka&#x1e25;</em>) Pat </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; pl. the family of Vi&#x015b;v&#x0101;mitra RV. AV </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (<em>&#x0101;</em>), f. N. of a river MBh </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>-kalpa</em> m. <em>&#x25cb;pa-taru</em> m. N. of wks </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>-jamad-agni</em> m. du. Vi&#x015b;v&#x0101;mitra and Jamad-agni RV </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>-nad&#x012b;</em> f. N. of a river MBh </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>-pura</em> n. or <em>-pur&#x012b;</em> f. N. of a town (<em>&#x25cb;r&#x012b;ya</em> mfn. ) Pratij&#x00f1;&#x0101;S </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>-priya</em> m. 'dear to Vi&#x015b;v&#x0101;mitra', the cocoa-nut tree L </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; N. of K&#x0101;rttikeya MBh </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>-r&#x0101;&#x015b;i</em> m. N. of a man Inscr </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>-sa&#x1e43;hit&#x0101;</em> f. N. of sev. wks </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>-s&#x1e5b;&#x1e63;&#x1e6d;i</em> f. Vi&#x015b;v&#x0101;mitra's creation (in allusion to several things fabled to have been created by this saint in rivalry of Brahm&#x0101;, e.g. the fruit of the Palmyra in imitation of the human skull, the buffalo in imitation of the cow, the ass of the horse &amp;c.) MW </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>-sm&#x1e5b;ti</em> f. N. of wk</dd>

           <dt>vi&#x015b;vas </dt>
           <dd><em>vi-&#x221a;&#x015b;vas</em> P. <em>-&#x015b;va&#x015b;iti</em> (ep. also <em>-&#x015b;vasati</em>, <em>&#x25cb;te</em>), to draw breath freely, be free from fear or apprehension, be trustful or confident, trust or confide in, rely or depend on (acc., gen., or loc.) MBh. K&#x0101;v. &amp;c.: Caus. <em>-&#x015b;v&#x0101;sayati</em>, to cause to trust, inspire with confidence, console, comfort, encourage K&#x0101;v. Kath&#x0101;s.            <dt>vi&#x1e63;aya </dt>
           <dd><em>vi&#x1e63;aya</em> m. (ifc. f. <em>&#x0101;</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; prob. either fr &#x221a;1. <em>vi&#x1e63;</em>, 'to act', or fr. <em>vi</em> + &#x221a;<em>si</em>, 'to extend', <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#P&#x0101;&#x1e47;">P&#x0101;&#x1e47;.</a> 8-3, 70 Sch.) sphere (of influence or activity), dominion, kingdom, territory, region, district, country, abode (pl. = lands, possessions) Mn. MBh. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; scope, compass, horizon, range, reach (of eyes, ears, mind &amp;c.) &#x015a;&#x0101;&#x1e45;kh&#x015a;r. MBh. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; period or duration (of life) Pa&#x00f1;cat </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; special sphere or department, peculiar province or tield of action, peculiar element, concern (ifc. = 'concerned with, belonging to, intently engaged on' </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>vi&#x1e63;aye</em>, with gen. or ifc. = 'in the sphere of, with regard or reference to' </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>atra vi&#x1e63;aye</em>, 'with regard to this object') MBh. K&#x0101;v. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; space or room (sometimes = fitness) for (gen.) K&#x0101;v. Pa&#x00f1;cat </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; an object of sense (these are five in number, the five <em>indriya</em>, or organs of sense having each their proper <em>vi&#x1e63;aya</em> or object, viz. 1. <em>&#x015b;abda</em>, 'sound', for the ear, cf. <em>&#x015b;ruti-vi&#x1e63;aya</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; 2. <em>spar&#x015b;a</em>, 'tangibility', for the skin </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; 3. <em>r&#x016b;pa</em>, 'form' or 'colour', for the eye </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; 4. <em>rasa</em>, 'savour', for the tongue </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; 5. <em>gandha</em>, 'odour' for the nose: and these five Vishayas are sometimes called the Gu&#x1e47;as or 'properties' of the five elements, ether, air, fire, water, earth, respectively </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; cf. <em>&#x015b;ruti-vi&#x1e63;aya-gu&#x1e47;a</em>) Y&#x0101;j&#x00f1;. &#x015a;a&#x1e43;k. Sarvad. IW. 83 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a symbolical N. of the number 'five' VarB&#x1e5b;S </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; anything perceptible by the senses, any object of affection or concern or attention, any special worldly object or aim or matter or business, (pl.) sensual enjoyments, sensuality Ka&#x1e6d;hUp. Mn. MBh. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; any subject or topic, subject-matter MBh. K&#x0101;v. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; an object (as opp. to 'a subject') Sarvad. <font color="#FF0000" font size=-2><a name="p997-2"></a>[Page 997, Column 2]</font> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a fit or suitable object ('for', dat., gen., or comp.) MBh. K&#x0101;v. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (in phil.) the subject of an argument, category, general head (one of the 5 members of an Adhikara&#x1e47;a <em>q.v.</em>, the other 4 being <em>vi&#x015b;aya</em> or <em>sa&#x1e43;&#x015b;aya</em>, <em>p&#x016b;rva-pak&#x1e63;a</em>, <em>uttara-pak&#x1e63;a</em> or <em>siddh&#x00e2;nta</em>, and <em>sa&#x1e43;gati</em> or <em>nir&#x1e47;aya</em>) Sarvad </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; un-organic matter IW. 73 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (in gram.) limited or restricted sphere (e.g. <em>chandasi vi&#x1e63;aye</em>, 'only in the Veda') K&#x0101;&#x015b;. (ifc. = restricted or exclusively belonging to) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (in rhet.) the subject of a comparison (e.g. in the comp. 'lotus-eye' the second member is the <em>vi&#x1e63;aya</em>, and the first the <em>vi&#x1e63;ayin</em>) Kuval. Prat&#x0101;p </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a country with more than 100 villages L </dd>

           <dt>vi&#x1e63;&#x1e47;u </dt>
           <dd><em>v&#x00ed;&#x1e63;&#x1e47;u</em> m. (prob. fr. &#x221a;<em>vi&#x1e63;</em>, 'All-pervader' or 'Worker') N. of one of the principal Hind&#x016b; deities (in the later mythology regarded as 'the preserver', and with Brahm&#x0101; 'the creator' and &#x015a;iva 'the destroyer', constituting the well-known Tri-m&#x016b;rti or triad </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; although Vish&#x1e47;u comes second in the triad he is identified with the supreme deity by his worshippers </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; in the Vedic period, however, he is not placed in the foremost rank, although he is frequently invoked with other gods [esp. with Indra whom he assists in killing V&#x1e5b;itra and with whom he drinks the Soma juice </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#his">his.</a> later names Indr&#x00e2;nuja and Up&#x00ea;ndra] </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; as distinguished from the other Vedic deities, he is a personification of the light and of the sun, esp. in his striding over the heavens, which he is said to do in three paces [see <em>tri-vikrama</em> and cf. <em>bali</em>, <em>v&#x0101;mana</em>], explained as denoting the threefold manifestations of light in the form of fire, lightning, and the sun, or as designating the three daily stations of the sun in his rising, culminating, and setting <font color="#FF0000" font size=-2><a name="p999-2"></a>[Page 999, Column 2]</font> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; Vish&#x1e47;u does not appear to have been included at first among the &#x0100;dityas <em>q.v.</em>, although in later times he is accorded the foremost place among them </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; in the Br&#x0101;hma&#x1e47;as he is identified with sacrifice, and in one described as a dwarf </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; in the Mah&#x0101;-bh&#x0101;rata and R&#x0101;maya&#x1e47;a he rises to the supremacy which in some places he now enjoys as the most popular deity of modern Hind&#x016b; worship </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the great rivalry between him and &#x015a;iva [cf. <em>vai&#x1e63;&#x1e47;ava</em> and <em>&#x015b;aiva</em>] is not fully developed till the period of the Pur&#x0101;&#x1e47;as the distinguishing feature in the character of the Post-vedic Vish&#x1e47;u is his condescending to become incarnate in a portion of his essence on ten principal occasions, to deliver mankind from certain great dangers [cf. <em>avat&#x0101;ra</em> and IW. 327] </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; some of the Pur&#x0101;&#x1e47;as make 22 incarnations, or even 24, instead of 10 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the Vaish&#x1e47;avas regard Vish&#x1e47;u as the supreme being, and often identify him with N&#x0101;r&#x0101;ya&#x1e47;a, the personified Purusha or primeval living spirit [described as moving on the waters, reclining on &#x015a;esha, the serpent of infinity, while the god Brahm&#x0101; emerges from a lotus growing from his navel </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Manu">Manu.</a> i, 10] </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the wives of Vish&#x1e47;u are Aditi and Sin&#x012b;v&#x0101;l&#x012b;, later Lakshm&#x012b; or &#x015a;r&#x012b; and even Sarasvat&#x012b; </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; his son is K&#x0101;ma-deva, god of love, and his paradise is called Vaiku&#x1e47;&#x1e6d;ha </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; he is usually represented with a peculiar mark on his breast called &#x015a;r&#x012b;-vatsa, and as holding a <em>&#x015b;a&#x1e45;kha</em>, or conch-shell called P&#x0101;&#x00f1;cajanya, a <em>cakra</em> or quoit-like missile-weapon called Su-dar&#x015b;ana, a <em>gad&#x0101;</em> or club called Kaumodak&#x012b; and a <em>padma</em> or lotus </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; he has also a bow called &#x015a;&#x0101;r&#x1e45;ga, and a sword called Nandaka </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; his <em>v&#x0101;hana</em> or vehicle is Garu&#x1e0d;a, q.v </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; he has a jewel on his wrist called Syamantaka, another on his breast called Kaustubha, and the river Ganges is said to issue from his foot </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the demons slain by him in his character of 'preserver from evil', or by K&#x1e5b;ish&#x1e47;a as identified with him, are Madhu, Dhenuka, C&#x0101;&#x1e47;&#x016b;ra, Yamala, and Arjuna [see <em>yamal&#x00e2;rjuna</em>], K&#x0101;la-nemi, Haya-gr&#x012b;va, &#x015a;aka&#x1e6d;a, Arish&#x1e6d;a, Kai&#x1e6d;abha, Ka&#x1e43;sa, Ke&#x015b;in, Mura, &#x015a;&#x0101;lva, Mainda, Dvi-vida, R&#x0101;hu, Hira&#x1e47;ya-ka&#x015b;ipu, B&#x0101;&#x1e47;a, K&#x0101;liya, Naraka, Bali </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; he is worshipped under a thousand names, which are all enumerated in MBh. xiii, 6950-7056 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; he is sometimes regarded as the divinity of the lunar mansion called &#x015a;rava&#x1e47;a) RV. &amp;c. &amp;c. (cf. RTL. 44 IW. 324) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; N. of the month Caitra VarB&#x1e5b;S </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (with <em>pr&#x0101;j&#x0101;patya</em>) of the author of RV. x, 84 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; of a son of Manu S&#x0101;var&#x1e47;a and Bhautya M&#x0101;rkP </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; of the writer of a law-book Y&#x0101;j&#x00f1; </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; of the father of the 11th Arhat of the present Avasarpi&#x1e47;i L </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (also with <em>ga&#x1e47;aka</em>, <em>kavi</em>, <em>daivaj&#x00f1;a</em>, <em>pa&#x1e47;&#x1e0d;ita</em>, <em>bha&#x1e6d;&#x1e6d;a</em>, <em>mi&#x015b;ra</em>, <em>yat&#x012b;7ndra</em>, <em>v&#x0101;japeyin</em>, <em>&#x015b;&#x0101;strin</em> &amp;c.) of various authors and others Inscr. Cat </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; = <em>agni</em> L </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; = <em>vasu-devat&#x0101;</em> L </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; = <em>&#x015b;uddha</em> L </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; f. N. of the mother of the 11th Arhat of the present Avasarpi&#x1e47;i L </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; n. pl. (in a formula) &#x0100;p&#x015a;r </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (<em>vi&#x1e63;&#x1e47;or</em> with <em>apamar&#x1e47;am</em>, <em>&#x0101;jya-doham</em>, <em>vratam</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; [<em>o&#x1e25;</em>] <em>s&#x0101;ma</em>, <em>svar&#x012b;ya&#x1e25;</em>, N. of S&#x0101;mans </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; with <em>&#x1e63;o&#x1e0d;a&#x015b;a-n&#x0101;ma-stotram</em>, <em>anusm&#x1e5b;ti&#x1e25;</em>, <em>a&#x1e63;&#x1e6d;&#x0101;vi&#x1e43;&#x015b;ati-n&#x0101;ma-stotram</em>, and <em>mah&#x0101;-stuti&#x1e25;</em>, N. of wks.)</dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; vi&#x1e63;&#x1e47;u&#x1e5b;k&#x1e63;a </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x25cb;&#x1e5b;k&#x1e63;a</em> n. the lunar mansion &#x015a;rava&#x1e47;a (presided over by Vish&#x1e47;u) Tithy&#x0101;d</dd>

           <dt>&#x226b; visarjan&#x012b;ya </dt>
           <dd><em>vi-sarjan&#x012b;ya</em> mfn. (fr. <em>vi-&#x221a;s&#x1e5b;j</em>) to be sent forth or emitted &amp;c. W </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (fr. <em>vi-sarjana</em>), See <em>vrata-visarjan&#x012b;ya</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; m. (cf. <em>vi-sarga</em> above) N. of a symbol in grammar (usually marked by two perpendicular dots [:] representing a hard and distinctly audible aspiration <font color="#FF0000" font size=-2><a name="p1001-2"></a>[Page 1001, Column 2]</font> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; it generally, but not always, occurs at the end of a word, often taking the place of final <em>s</em> and <em>r</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; it is called Visarjan&#x012b;ya either from its liability to be 'rejected' or from its being pronounced with a full 'emission' of breath, or from its usually appearing at the 'end' of a word or sentence </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; Pa&#x1e47;&#x1e0d;its in some parts of India seem to pronounce a vowel after it, e.g. <em>nara&#x1e25;</em> like <em>naraha</em>, <em>agni&#x1e25;</em> like <em>agnihi</em>) Pr&#x0101;t. P&#x0101;&#x1e47;. &amp;c</dd>

           <dd><em>v&#x00ed;-s&#x1e5b;&#x1e63;&#x1e6d;a</em> mfn. sent or poured forth, let go, allowed to flow or run, discharged, emitted, shed, cast, thrown, hurled RV. &amp;c. &amp;c </dd>

           <dd>&#x2022; <em>-dhena</em> (<em>v&#x00ed;&#x25cb;</em>), mfn. streaming or yielding milk RV </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>-bh&#x016b;mi</em> mfn. one who has space or room given (to sit down &amp;c.) MW </dd>

           <dd>&#x2022; of a priest Cat </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>-dayit&#x0101;</em> or <em>-priy&#x0101;</em> f. 'beloved of V&#x012b;ti-hotra i.e. Agni', N. of a Sv&#x0101;h&#x0101; Pa&#x00f1;car</dd>

           <dt>v&#x012b; 3</dt>
           <dd><em>v&#x012b;7</em> (<em>vi-</em> &#x221a;5. <em>i</em>), P. <em>vy-eti</em> (3. pl. <em>viyanti</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; impf. <em>vy-ait</em> </dd>

           <dd>&#x2022; to be lost, perish, disappear Up. MBh. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to go through, traverse RV. VS. AitBr.: Intens. (or cl. 4) &#x0100;. <em>vii7yate</em>, to pass through, traverse RV</dd>

           <dd><em>vir&#x00e1;</em> m. a man, (esp.) a brave or eminent man, hero, chief (sometimes applied to gods, as to Indra, Vish&#x1e47;u &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; pl. men, people, mankind, followers, retainers) RV. &amp;c. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a hero (as opp. to a god) RTL. 272, n </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a husband MBh. R. Pur </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a male child, son (collect. male progeny) RV. AV. Br. G&#x1e5b;&#x015a;rS </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (collect. male progeny) RV. AV. Br. G&#x1e5b;&#x015a;rS </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the male of an animal AV. &#x015a;&#x0101;&#x1e45;kh&#x015a;r </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (with, T&#x0101;ntrikas) an adept (who is between the <em>divya</em> and the <em>pa&#x015b;u</em> RTL. 191) Rudray </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (in dram.) heroism (as one of the 8 Rasas <em>q.v.</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the V&#x012b;ra-carita <em>q.v.</em> exhibits an example) Bhar. Da&#x015b;ar. S&#x0101;h. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; an actor W </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a partic. Agni (son of Tapas) MBh </dd>

           <dd><em>&#x25cb;bhadra</em> m. a distinguished hero L </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a horse fit for the A&#x015b;va-medha sacrifice L </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; Andropogon Muricatus L </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; N. of a Rudra Y&#x0101;j&#x00f1;. Sch </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; of an incarnation or form of &#x015a;iva (sometimes regarded as his son, and worshipped esp. in the Mar&#x0101;&#x1e6d;ha country </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; in the V&#x0101;yu-Pur&#x0101;&#x1e47;a he is said to have been created from &#x015a;iva's mouth in order to spoil the sacrifice of Daksha, and is described as having a thousand heads, a thousand eyes, a thousand feet, and wielding a thousand clubs </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; his appearance is fierce and terrific, he is clothed in a tiger's skin dripping with blood, and he bears a blazing bow and battle-axe </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; in another Pur&#x0101;&#x1e47;a he is described as produced from a drop of &#x015a;iva's sweat) MBh. Pur. Kath&#x0101;s. &amp;c. (RTL. 79 ; 82) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; of a warrior on the side of the P&#x0101;&#x1e47;&#x1e0d;avas MBh </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; of a king and various authors Cat </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>-k&#x0101;lik&#x0101;-vacana</em> n. N. of a ch. of the V&#x012b;ra-bhadra-tantra </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>-camp&#x016b;</em> f. N. of a poem </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>-jit</em> m. 'conqueror of V&#x012b;ra', N. of Vish&#x1e47;u Pa&#x00f1;car </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>-tantra</em> n. N. of a Tantra </dd>

           <dd><em>v&#x1e5b;tr&#x00e1;</em> m. (only once in TS.) or n. (mostly in pl.) 'coverer, investor, restrainer', an enemy, foe, hostile host RV. TS </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; m. N. of the Vedic personification of an imaginary malignant influence or demon of darkness and drought (supposed to take possession of the clouds, causing them to obstruct the clearness of the sky and keep back the waters </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; Indra is represented as battling with this evil influence in the pent up clouds poetically pictured as mountains or castles which are shattered by his thunderbolt and made to open their receptacles [<a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#esp">esp.</a> RV. i, 31] </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; as a D&#x0101;nava, V&#x1e5b;itra is a son of Tvash&#x1e6d;&#x1e5b;i, or of Danu, q.v., and is often identified with Ahi, the serpent of the sky, and associated with other evil spirits, such as &#x015a;ush&#x1e47;a, Namuci, Pipru, &#x015a;ambara, Ura&#x1e47;a, whose malignant influences are generally exercised in producing darkness or drought) RV. &amp;c. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a thunder-cloud RV. iv, 10, 5 (cf. Naigh. i, 10) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; darkness L </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a wheel L </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a mountain L </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; N. of a partic. mountain L </dd>

           <dt>v&#x1e5b; 2</dt>
           <dd><em>v&#x1e5b;</em> cl. 5. 9. P. &#x0100;. (Dh&#x0101;tup. xxvii, 8 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; xxxi, 16, 20) <em>v&#x1e5b;&#x1e47;oti</em>, <em>v&#x1e5b;&#x1e47;ute</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>v&#x1e5b;&#x1e47;&#x0101;&#x0341;ti</em>, (mostly) <em>v&#x1e5b;&#x1e47;&#x012b;t&#x00e9;</em> (in RV. also <em>v&#x00e1;ras</em>, <em>&#x25cb;rat</em>, <em>&#x25cb;ranta</em>, but these may be Subj. aor </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; pf. <em>vav&#x0101;ra</em> Bha&#x1e6d;&#x1e6d; </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>vavre</em> RV. [2. sg. <em>vav&#x1e5b;&#x1e63;&#x00e9;</em>, 1. pl. <em>vav&#x1e5b;m&#x00e1;he</em>] &amp;c. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; aor. <em>avri</em>, <em>av&#x1e5b;ta</em> RV. [Pot. <em>vur&#x012b;ta</em>, p. <em>ur&#x0101;&#x1e47;&#x00e1;</em>] &amp;c. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>av&#x1e5b;&#x1e63;i</em>, <em>&#x25cb;&#x1e63;ata</em> AV. Br. [2. pl. <em>av&#x1e5b;&#x1e0d;hvam</em>] Up </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; [avar˘ISTa] Gr </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; Prec. <em>vari&#x1e63;&#x012b;&#x1e63;&#x1e6d;a</em> ib </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; fut. [var˘ItA] ib </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>vari&#x1e63;yate</em> Br </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>var&#x012b;&#x1e63;yate</em> Gr </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; inf. <em>var&#x012b;tum</em> Bha&#x1e6d;&#x1e6d;. R&#x0101;jat </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>varitum</em> Gr </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; ind. p. <em>varitv&#x0101;</em> or <em>v&#x1e5b;tv&#x0101;</em> G&#x1e5b;&#x015a;rS. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>var&#x012b;tv&#x0101;</em> Gr.), to choose, select, choose for one's self, choose as (<em>-arthe</em> or acc. of pers.) or for (<em>-artham</em> or dat., loc., instr. of thing) RV. &amp;c. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to choose in marriage, woo MBh. K&#x0101;v. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to ask a person (acc.) for (acc.) or on behalf of (<em>k&#x1e5b;te</em>) R. Kath&#x0101;s </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to solicit anything (acc.) from (abl. or <em>-tas</em>), Kav. Pur </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to ask or request that (Pot. with or without <em>iti</em>) R. MBh </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to like better than, prefer to (abl., rarely instr.) RV. AitBr. MBh. R </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to like, love (as opp. to 'hate') MBh. v, 4149 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to choose or pick out a person (for a boon), grant (a boon) to (acc.) R&#x0101;jat. iii, 421: Caus. (Dh&#x0101;tup. xxxv, 2) <em>varayati</em>, <em>&#x25cb;te</em> (ep. also <em>v&#x0101;rayati</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; Pass. <em>vary&#x00e1;te</em> Br.) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to choose, choose for one's self, choose as (acc. of pers.) or for (<em>-artham</em> dat. or loc. of thing), ask or sue for (acc.) or on behalf of (dat. or <em>-arthe</em>), choose as a wife (acc. with or without <em>patn&#x012b;m</em>, <em>d&#x0101;r&#x0101;n</em>, or <em>patny-artham</em>) Br.            <dd>&#x2022; to like, love well R. [Cf. Lat. <em>velle</em> ; Slav. <em>voliti</em> ; Got. <em>wiljian</em> ; Germ. <em>wollan</em>, <em>wollen</em>, <em>Wahl</em>, <em>wohl</em> ; Angl. Sax. <em>willan</em> ; Eng. <em>will</em>.]</dd>

           <dd>&#x2022; Cond. <em>avartsyat</em> Br </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>avarti&#x1e63;yata</em> Gr </dd>

           <dd>&#x2022; <em>-v&#x1e5b;&#x0301;tas</em> Br </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>vartitum</em> MBh. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; ind. p. <em>vartitv&#x0101;</em> and <em>v&#x1e5b;ttv&#x0101;</em> Gr </dd>

           <dd>&#x2022; <em>-v&#x00e1;rtam</em> Br. &amp;c.), to turn, turn round, revolve, roll (also applied to the rolling down of tears) RV. &amp;c. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to move or go on, get along, advance, proceed (with instr. 'in a partic. way or manner'), take place, occur, be performed, come off Mn. MBh. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to be, live, exist, be found, remain, stay, abide, dwell (with <em>&#x0101;tmani na</em>, 'to be not in one's right mind' </dd>

           <dd>&#x2022; to be intent on, attend to (dat.) R </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to stand or be used in the sense of (loc.) K&#x0101;&#x015b; </dd>

           <dd>&#x2022; to continue (with an ind. p., <em>at&#x012b;7tya vartante</em>, 'they continue to excel' </dd>

           <dd>&#x2022; to originate, arise from (abl.) or in (loc.) BhP </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to become TBr </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to associate with (<em>saha</em>) Pa&#x00f1;cat </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to have illicit intercourse with (loc.) R.: Caus. <em>vart&#x00e1;yati</em> (aor. <em>aviiv&#x1e5b;tat</em> or <em>avavartat</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; in TBr. also &#x0100;. <em>avavarti</em> </dd>

           <dd>&#x2022; 'to speak' or 'to shine' (<em>bh&#x0101;&#x1e63;&#x00e2;rthe</em> or <em>bh&#x0101;s&#x00e2;rthe</em>) Dh&#x0101;tup. xxxiii, 108: Desid. <em>v&#x00ed;v&#x1e5b;tsati</em>, <em>&#x25cb;te</em> (RV.            <dd>&#x2022; course, manner, way (in which anything happens or is done) MBh. Vikr </dd>

           <dd><em>v&#x1e5b;tti</em> f. rolling, rolling down (of tears) &#x015a;ak. iv, 5 ; 14 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; mode of life or conduct, course of action, behaviour, (esp.) moral conduct, kind or respectful behaviour or treatment (also v&#x1e37;. for <em>v&#x1e5b;tta</em>) G&#x1e5b;&#x015a;rS. Mn. MBh. &amp;c </dd>

           <dd>&#x2022; mode of being, nature, kind, character, disposition ib. K&#x0101;v </dd>

           <dd>&#x2022; with gen., 'to get or procure a maintenance for' </dd>

           <dd>&#x2022; the use or occurrence of a word in a partic. sense (loc.), its function or force P&#x0101;&#x1e47;. S&#x0101;h. Sch. on K&#x0101;ty&#x015a;r. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; mode or measure of pronunciation and recitation (said to be threefold, viz. <em>vilambit&#x0101;</em>, <em>madhyam&#x0101;</em>, and <em>drut&#x0101;</em>, q.v.) Pr&#x0101;t </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (in gram.) a complex formation which requires explanation or separation into its parts (as distinguished from a simple or uncompounded form, e.g. any word formed with K&#x1e5b;it or Taddhita affixes, any compound and even duals and plurals which are regarded as Dvandva compounds, of which only one member is left, and all derivative verbs such as desideratives &amp;c.) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; style of composition (esp. dram. style, said to be of four kinds, viz. 1. Kai&#x015b;ik&#x012b;, 2. Bh&#x0101;rat&#x012b; 3. S&#x0101;tvat&#x012b;, 4. &#x0100;rabha&#x1e6d;&#x012b;, qq.vv </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the first three are described as suited to the &#x015a;&#x1e5b;i&#x1e45;g&#x0101;ra, V&#x012b;ra, and Raudra Rasas respectively, the last as common to all) Bhar. Da&#x015b;ar. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (in rhet.) alliteration, frequent repetition of the same consonant (five kinds enumerated, scil. <em>madhur&#x0101;</em>, <em>pr&#x00e2;u&#x1e0d;h&#x0101;</em>, <em>puru&#x1e63;&#x0101;</em>, <em>lalit&#x0101;</em>, and <em>bhadr&#x0101;</em>) Da&#x015b;ar., Introd </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; final rhythm of a verse (= or v&#x1e37;. for <em>v&#x1e5b;tta</em>, q.v.) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a commentary, comment, gloss, explanation (esp. on a S&#x016b;tra) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; N. of the wife of a Rudra BhP</dd>
